AND BOASTED ABOUT IT TOO&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8btg6T2y5SA/U7UjdnNO7xI/AAAAAAAAtN0/W-gMaQCKabM/s1600/RBMNF17.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-8btg6T2y5SA/U7UjdnNO7xI/AAAAAAAAtN0/W-gMaQCKabM/s1600/RBMNF17.JPG\" width=\"518\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Above: &nbsp;SIR Richard Francis Burton . He may have known several other languages - &nbsp;but he has NIL , repeat NIL , repeat zilch knowledge of Sanskrit.</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"Chathushshashtyaa\nThanthraihi Sakalamathisandhaaya Bhuvanam<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sththithisthaththathsiddhiprasavaparathanthraihi\nPashupathihi!<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punasthvannirbandhaadakhilapurushaarthaikaghatanaa<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Swathanthram They\nThanthram Kshithithalamavaatheetharadidam!\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\"Shiva at first remained satisfied after giving to the world, the\nsixty-four tantras which expound practices conferring only one or another of\nthe various psychic powers and worldly&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">fulfillments</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">. Afterwards, on&nbsp;Thy special\ninsistence, He revealed this Thy own tantra to the world, independent of all\nthe others and capable of conferring all the four aspirations of men- &nbsp; dharma, &nbsp; &nbsp;artha,<b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"> &nbsp;kama</b> and moksha.</span></span></span></i><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\" ( </span></span><b style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Saundarya Lahari Verse 31 _ Adi Shankaracharya 2000 BC</b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> )<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">For introducing sexual\nperversion to India the queen of England , knighted a rogue British East India\nCompany employee, two years after he translated the FAKE Kamasutra , injected\nwith sexual perversion and immoral innuendo.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India was ruled by R , the owner\nof British East India Company , and NOT the queen of England or the British\nParliament as is generally believed . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the British Raj,\nChristian missionaries were allowed a free run. &nbsp;Their main thrust was to make the Hindu self\nloathing for easier conversions to Christianity. &nbsp;They found out that the Hindu faith was so\nstrong that even poor and vulnerable Hindus rejected sops.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They were successful in\nconverting Hindusim into a religion practices by savages , who did animal and\nhuman sacrifices, &nbsp;and had immoral sexual\npractices .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A incident made them\ndouble their efforts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 1839, Capt TS Burt ,\nan engineer of the British East India Company stumbled on to some huge stone\nblock structures in a dense forest infested with wild animals and snakes.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was getting dark, so\nhe came back the next day with a huge work force to clear the thicket , and\nwhat they saw struck the wind out of their sails. They were least prepared for\na sight, out of this world. In an area of 9 square miles they found 85\nvandalized temples, of which 25 were partially intact.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Amazing erotic\nsculptures lay shattered everywhere with hammers .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Chandela Rajput\nDynasty who built these temples in the forest above belonged to the Tantric\nVamachara of left handed branch of Hinduism. &nbsp;This was also a time when many young Hindu\nwarriors were becoming celibate Buddhist monks.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient Indian\nkings in all their practical wisdom realized this and made all those Hindu\ntemples with erotic stone statues with amazing sexual content, to wean away a\npotential yogi who could have been a soldier or a farmer or a husband..</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If you visit the famous\nKhajuraho temples less than 15% of the sculptures are sexual . The rest depict other\naspects life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two ways to a\ngoal. &nbsp;&nbsp;An acceptable to society front door entry and\nan unacceptable and maybe more pleasurable back door entry.&nbsp; &nbsp;Vamachara\n&nbsp;Tantric branch took this faster back\ndoor entry. The goal was cosmic consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">None of the erotic\nsculptures were inside the temple\u2014all of them were outside , which meant to a perceptive\nman that these practices outside had NO place inside the temple.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of these\nsculptures were vulgar and immoral. &nbsp; The most severe\npunishment ( beheading ) &nbsp;was also included .&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0jitk_o7Sso/U7UAY5tqAhI/AAAAAAAAtNk/EPT4E-zf58M/s1600/b1.jpkkkg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Later over time the white invader cleverly\nremoved the punishments sculptures and retroinstalled more of perverted sculptures\nin their missing places in the missing slots.&nbsp;\nThey introduced homosexuality and bestiality too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Much later they created\ntheir own FAKE Hindu saints and back dated them over brandy and cigars. &nbsp;For example FAKE Swami Ramanuja used to preach\nin front a bestial sex stone mural ( a dog servicing a woman ) at Srirangam which\nthe saint Ramanuja found very very normal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Most are\ncoded and are difficult to understand without a commentary made by a perceptive\nman. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Richard Francis Burton\nstayed in my hometown Calicut in the month of Sept 1847. &nbsp;He came from Nilgiri hills to board a ship to\nBombay from Calicut.&nbsp;&nbsp; We know him\nwell.&nbsp; &nbsp;Later I will give some details about this immoral\nrogue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Richard Francis Burton translated\nthe Kama Sutra of Vatsayana (1883) and The Ananga Ranga (1885),<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ananga Ranga ( Stage\nof Love ) or Kamaledhiplava ( Boat in the Sea of Love ) is an perverted sex\nmanual written by Kalyana malla. The poet wrote the sex manual for Lad Khan, son of Ahmed Khan Lodi ( Lodi\ndynasty, ruled from Delhi from 1451 to 1526 ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The book contains\nvarious sexual poses of a Muslim invader king showing his phallus and the\nvagina &nbsp;\u2014 NOT a ancient Hindu.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Richard Francis Burton\ndid NOT know about vatsayana . He says that while translating with the pundits\nthe 'Anunga ranga, or the stage of love,' reference was frequently found to be\nmade to one Vatsya ( sic !). &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sage Vatsa was of\nthis opinion, or of that opinion. The sage Vatsa said this, and so on.\nNaturally questions were asked who the sage was, and the pundits replied that\nVatsya was the author of the standard work on love in Sanskrit literature, that\nno Sanskrit library was complete without his work, and that it was most\ndifficult now to obtain in its entire state. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The copy of the\nmanuscript obtained in Bombay was defective, and so the pundits wrote to\nBenares, Calcutta and Jeypoor (sic ) for copies of the manuscript from Sanskrit\nlibraries in those places. Copies having been obtained, they were then compared\nwith each other, and with the aid of a Commentary called 'Jayamangla' a revised\ncopy of the entire manuscript was prepared, and from this copy the English\ntranslation was made. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The following is the\ncertificate of the chief pundit:\u2014( I hope Richard Francis Burton got it on\nstamp paper and got it signed in front of a Rothschild\u2019s magistrate- &nbsp;TEE HEEEEEE ! ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\"<i>The accompanying\nmanuscript is corrected by me after comparing four different copies of the\nwork. I had the assistance of a Commentary called 'Jayamangla' for correcting\nthe portion in the first five parts, but found great difficulty in correcting\nthe remaining portion, because, with the exception of one copy thereof which\nwas tolerably correct, all the other copies I had were far too incorrect.\nHowever, I took that portion as correct in which the majority of the copies\nagreed with each other.</i>\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient Hindu tradition\nsees life as a spiritual journey, with each and every aspect governed by one or\nmore of the following motives:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1). Dharma: Virtuous\nliving.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2). Artha: Material\nprosperity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3). Kama: Gratification\nof the human senses. This does NOT mean a perverted sexual orgy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4). Moksha: Liberation\nfrom the endless cycle of rebirths .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharishi Manu took the\n\u201cDharm\u201d part of this book and made an independent subject \u201cDharm shastra\u201d .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharishi Brihaspati (\nThor/ Zued in the West ) took the \u201cArth\u201d part of it and developed \u201cArthshastra\u201d\nfrom it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maharishi Vatsa took\nthe Kama part of it and composed the Kamasutra in Sanskrit. The book is not\nonly about the copulation between male and female but it also deals with\nromance /conduct, interaction, marriage, lifestyle and\nentertainment.&nbsp; Kama sutra had a deep\nimpact on Indian society meant for the GRIHASTHA stage of life ( age 25 to age\n50)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PSSST \u2013 WANNA HEAR WHAT\nTHE LYING&nbsp; WESTERN MUFFS SAY ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE : <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201cNandi the bull writing\nKamasutra is found in Mahabharat\u2013 (1.1.6-8) \"Nandi the sacred bull,\nShiva's doorkeeper, who was moved to sacred utterance by overhearing the\nlovemaking of the Lord Shiva and his wife Parvati\"&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BLAH BLAH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The earliest text of\nthe Kama Shastra tradition, contained a vast amount of information was said to\nhave told by Lord Siva himself to his wife Parvati. During the 8th century BC,\nShvetaketu, son of Uddalaka, produced a summary of Nandi's work, but this\n\"summary\" was still too vast to be accessible. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BLAH BLAH<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A scholar called\nBabhravya, together with a group of his disciples, produced a summary of\nShvetaketu's summary, which nonetheless remained a huge and encyclopaedic tome.\nBetween the 3rd and 1st centuries BC, several authors reproduced different\nparts of the Babhravya group's work in various specialist treatises. Among the\nauthors, those whose names are known are Charayana, Ghotakamukha, Gonardiya,\nGonikaputra, Suvarnanabha, and Dattaka. BLAH BLAH BLAH <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oh Boy !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sunil Kakkar and Wendy\nDoniger work as a team. &nbsp;They have a new\ntranslation of the Kamasutra of Vatsyayana (Oxford University Press, 2002). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wendy Doniger (\nUniversity of Chicago professor ) has promoted herself as a great Sanskrit\nscholar. , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A male, a son for to\nprocure!\u201d</i>&nbsp; (Brhad-\u00c2ranyaka Upanisad, 6.4.20\u20145000 BC)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">During the absence of\nher husband on a journey the virtuous woman should wear only her auspicious\nornaments, and observe the fasts in honour of the Gods. &nbsp;While anxious to hear the news of her husband,\nshe should still look after her household affairs. &nbsp;She should sleep near the elder women of the\nhouse, and make herself agreeable to them. &nbsp;She should look after and keep in repair the\nthings that are liked by her husband, and continue the works that have been\nbegun by him. &nbsp;To the abode of her\nrelations she should not go except on occasions of joy and sorrow, and then she\nshould go in her usual travelling dress, accompanied by her husband's servants,\nand not remain there for a long time. &nbsp;The\nfasts and feasts should be observed with the consent of the elders of the\nhouse. &nbsp;The resources should be increased\nby making purchases and sales according to the practice of the merchants and by\nmeans of honest servants, superintended by herself. &nbsp;The income should be increased, and the\nexpenditure diminished as much possible. &nbsp;And when her husband returns from his journey,\nshe should receive him at first in her ordinary clothes, so that he may know in\nwhat way she has lived during his absence, and should bring to him some\npresents, as also materials for the worship of the Deity.\"</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; &nbsp;Can we substitute ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dastard even incorporated\nthe Filipino BOLITA in Maharishi Vatsa\u2019s work.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE :&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a young man perforates his lingam he\nshould pierce it with a sharp instrument, and then stand in water so long as\nthe blood continues to flow. At night he should engage in sexual intercourse,\neven with vigour, so as to clean the hole. After this he should continue to\nwash the hole with decoctions, and increase the size by putting into it small\npieces of cane, and the wrightia antidysenterica, and thus gradually enlarging\nthe orifice. It may also be washed with liquorice mixed with honey, and the\nsize of the hole increased by the fruit stalks of the sima-patra plant. The\nhole should be annointed with a small quantity of oil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the hole made in the\nlingam a man may put Apadravyas of various forms, such as the\n\"round,\" the \"round on one side,\" the \"wooden\nmortar,\" the \"flower,\" the \"armlet,\" the \"bone of\nthe heron,\" the \"goad of the elephant,\" the \"collection of\neight balls,\" the \"lock of hair,\" the \"place where four\nroads meet,\" and other things named according to their forms and means of\nusing them. All these Apadravyas should be rough on the outside according to\ntheir requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNQUOTE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rasputin had a natural\nBOLITA on his dong .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>RASPUTIN AND HIS WART &nbsp;VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And hey. Maharishi\nVatsa even talked about how to enlarge the prick as per the dastard.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a man wishes to\nenlarge his lingam, he should rub it with the bristles of certain insects that\nlive in trees, and then, after rubbing it for ten nights with oils, he should\nagain rub it with the bristles as before. By continuing to do this a swelling\nwill be gradually produced in the lingam, and he should then lie on a cot, and\ncause his lingam to hang down through a hole in the cot. After this he should\ntake away all the pain from the swelling by using cool concoctions. The\nswelling, which is called \"Suka,\" and is often brought about among\nthe people of the Dravida country, lasts for life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Burton returned to\nthe British Army he sat for examination as an Arab linguist. The examiner was\nRobert Lambert Playfair, who disliked slimy Burton. &nbsp;As Professor George Percy Badger knew Arabic\nwell, Playfair asked Badger to oversee the exam, to be fair. &nbsp;&nbsp;Having\nbeen told that Burton could be play dirty and be vindictive and avoiding any\nanimosity should Burton fail, Badger declined. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Playfair conducted the tests, sending the\nresults to Badger. &nbsp;Despite Burton's\nsuccess living as an Arab, Badger failed him. Badger later told Burton that\n\"After looking them over, I sent them back to him with a note eulogising\nyour attainments and ... remarking on the absurdity of the Bombay Committee\nbeing made to judge your proficiency inasmuch as I did not believe that any of\nthem possessed a tithe of the knowledge of Arabic you did.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So much for his\nlanguage proficiency.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rati stands for sexual\npleasure, carnal desire and sexuality.&nbsp;\nRati, as well as her husband Kama( the Hindu god of love ,the West\nlifted as cupid )&nbsp; ride a parrot as their\nvahana (vehicle). The love-deity couple also symbolize maithuna, &nbsp;ritual sexual union.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rati bhava and desires\n( kama) of various kinds . Rati is the female counterpart, the chief consort of\nKama ( Kamadeva), the god of love. &nbsp;Rati\nis often depicted with Kama in legend and temple sculpture Rati is often\nassociated with the arousal and delight of sexual activity, and many sex\ntechniques and positions derive their Sanskrit names from hers. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the god Shiva\nburnt her husband to ashes, it was Rati, whose beseeching or penance, leads to\nthe promise of Kama's resurrection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Shiva had turned\nto ascetic ways after the death of his first wife, Sati. &nbsp;Kama was thus instructed by the gods to make\nShiva fall in love again so that the cosmos may survive . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kama went to Mount\nKailash with Rati and Madhu or Vasanta (\"Spring\"), and shot his\nlove-arrows at Shiva . &nbsp;Wounded by Kama's\narrows, Shiva becomes attracted to Parvati, the reincarnation of Sati, whips up\nan inner fire and opens his third eye and turns Kama to ashes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The grief-stricken Rati\ngoes mad by Kama's death and in the Matsya Purana/Padma Purana &nbsp;she smears herself with her husband's ashes. &nbsp;In Bhagavata Purana, Rati undergoes severe\npenance and pleads with Parvati to intercede with Shiva to restore her husband. &nbsp;In the Matsya Purana, the Padma Purana, the Shiva Purana, the Linga Purana and\nthe Kathasaritsagara, Shiva blesses Rati with the boon of Kama's resurrection. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When persuaded by\nParvati, Shiva brings Kamadeva back to life but only in SPIRIT\u2026without a body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Almost all our ancient 7000 year old puranas\nhave been injected with posion by the white invader using their Indin stooges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The name Rati in\nSanskrit means \" sexual passion / amorous enjoyment\", which Rati\npersonifies. Rati also indicates the female-seed. Kama- Rati is a man stupefied\nby desire. Rati-karman (\"sexual intercourse\"), rati-laksha\n(\"sexual intercourse\"), rati-bhoga (\"sexual enjoyment\"),\nrati-shakti (\"virile power\"), rati-jna (\"skilled in the art of\nlove\") must the understood the right way.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Rati also appears in title of the Sanskrit erotic work\nRati-Rahasya (\"secrets of Rati\") \u2013 which gives G spot sex techniques\nand positions .Rati-pasha (\"the noose of Rati\"), a sex position in\nwhich the woman locks her legs behind her lover's back to control pressure &nbsp;on the G spot.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nShringa means a horn or a peak.,\n\"A peak or climax of delight.\" \u2013NOT NECESSARILY\nAN ORGASM.&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nSRUTI VERSES ARE CODED AND NEED PERCEPTION<span style=\"color: red;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The highly complex\nmodes, represented in sculptures, are metaphors for QUENCHING the mind in the\nGRIHASTA stage , with the final goal of moksha.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Much of the content of\ntraditional Indian arts revolves around the relationship between a man and a\nwoman.&nbsp; The primary emotion thus\ngenerated is Sringara.&nbsp; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samba was a son of\nKrishna, and Jambavati. &nbsp;</i></span><i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Samba was very handsome\nand the dearest son of Krishna. &nbsp;</i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Pampered Samba did many\nunbearable things which led the whole Yadu dynasty to its end.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samba misbehaved to\nsuch an extent that Krishna became extremely, extremely displeased with him.\nKrishna went on scolding Samba and insulting him in this manner in presence of\nJambavati. &nbsp;One day out of exasperation\nKrishna cursed his own son.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Samba immediately\nstarted suffering from leprosy. His body became disfigured overnight and he was\nin great agony from the disease. Lord Krishna\u2019s wife could not endure seeing\nher son tortured in this way. With tears streaming from her eyes, she\napproached her husband and told her unbearable pain for their son. Krishna\nrelented and told his son, the way to be cured. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>He explained his son to\npray the sun god and then to take bath in the river Chandrabhaga ultimately\nimmersing in the water, will cure the disease. Samba was unable to even get up.\nJambavati appealed to her husband to either take Samba to the river or cure him\nat the place, he is lying. Finally, Krishna agreed to take his son to the river\nand thus he was completely cured. Krishna\u2019s curse had been nullified.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Three very great sages\nonce came to Lord Krishna\u2019s palace in Dwaraka. Krishna was resting. When he was\ninformed of their arrival, he said, \u201cPlease tell them that I shall be there in\na short while. In the meantime, let them be welcomed with proper respect and\ndevotion.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Unfortunately, over the\nyears, Krishna\u2019s relatives and others who were close to him had become very\nundivine. Because they were dear to Krishna, they used to get everything for\nthe asking. As a result, they became corrupted by the pleasure-life. They used\nto drink and quarrel and do all kinds of unthinkable things.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A few members of\nKrishna\u2019s immediate family did not have any respect for the sages and saints\nwho came to pay homage to Krishna. These relatives felt that as long as they\nhad Krishna, it was enough. To them, all other spiritual people were as\nworthless as straw.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Krishna\u2019s son, Samba,\nwas then twenty-five or twenty-six years old. Even though he was no longer a\nchild, he and some other young men decided to play </i><b style=\"font-style: italic;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">a practical joke on the\nthree sages.</span></b><i> Samba\u2019s friends tied an earthen pot on his stomach and </i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><i><b>dressed him\nin a nice sari</b></i></span><i>. Then they brought him before the sages.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The young men said to\nthe sages, \u201cThis woman is with child. Please, before Krishna comes, can you\ntell us whether she will give birth to a boy or a girl?\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Since the sages had\noccult vision, they immediately saw that the young men were mocking them. They\nbecame furious. \u201cYou are Krishna\u2019s relatives! You, Samba, are his own son! You\ndare to make fun of us! Yes, this \u2018woman\u2019 will give birth, but she will give birth\nto an iron rod. This rod will bring about the destruction of Krishna\u2019s entire\nclan. You have no respect for spiritual people. We are great sages and you have\nmocked us.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>At that moment, Krishna\nentered the hall. He was so sad to hear the curse of the sages. At the same\ntime, he knew that the curse was well deserved . The sages also felt sorry that\nthey had uttered such a dreadful curse, but they did not have enough capacity\nor forgiveness-power to withdraw it. <o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>In spite of this\nunfortunate turn of events, Krishna stayed and had a long talk with the sages,\nand they received Krishna\u2019s blessings. Krishna was beyond, beyond everything.\nHe advised them and illumined them, and then the sages departed.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>In due course, the\ncurse came true and Krishna\u2019s son gave birth to a heavy iron rod, like a club.\nSamba and his cousins realised that their destruction was imminent. They went\nto Krishna and begged him to save them. Krishna said, \u201cYou have done something\nunpardonable, unpardonable. What can I do? All right, grind the whole iron rod\ninto a powder. It will take a very, very long time. When it becomes powder, you\nmust throw the powder into the sea.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>With utmost enthusiasm\nand zeal, the young men started grinding the rod. But after a short time, they\nstopped and simply threw the rod into the sea. They did not grind the whole rod\ninto powder, as Krishna had told them to do.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Many, many years later,\nafter the battle of Kurukshetra, the iron rod came up to the surface of the sea\nand the prophecy of the sages came true. Krishna\u2019s family members started\ndrinking heavily and fighting among themselves. Krishna\u2019s\ndearer-than-the-dearest friend, Satyaki, who had fought so bravely on the side\nof the Pandavas during the battle, was killed in a quarrel. One by one, all of\nthe great warriors in Krishna\u2019s family were killed in this drunken brawl.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>When Krishna saw that\nhis dearest Satyaki had been killed, he said, \u201cThere is no need to stay on\nearth any longer.\u201d In the meantime, Krishna\u2019s brother, Balarama, had been\nobserving the brawl. He saw the level to which the great heroes had descended\nand he was disgusted. \u201cEnough, enough!\u201d he said. \u201cOur family has become so\ncorrupt!\u201d He entered into the forest and in his meditation he gave up his\nlife-breath.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>When Krishna heard that\nBalarama had left the body, he said, \u201cMy time has also come. Let me go and join\nhim.\u201d Krishna went to a beautiful place. There, he sat down under a tree and he\nstarted meditating; he wanted to give up his life.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>A hunter was passing\nby. He saw Krishna\u2019s form and thought it was a beautiful deer. To him,\nKrishna\u2019s left foot looked like the ear of the deer. The hunter aimed his arrow\nat the ear and released it. The arrow entered Krishna through the sole of his\nleft foot and that was the only weak point in Krishna\u2019s body.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>All his limbs and\nall the other parts of his body were invincible, but his left foot was\nvulnerable. Whenever he fought, he used to keep that foot well-protected. But\nhe knew that it was weak and Balarama also knew it.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>When the hunter came to\nclaim the deer, he saw Krishna lying on the ground with the arrow piercing his\nfoot. The hunter cried pitifully for forgiveness. But Krishna answered him,\n\u201cNo, it is not your fault. My time has come. That is why this has happened. It\nis all predestined.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u201cHow is it\npredestined?\u201d asked the hunter.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>\u201cThis is the curse of\nGandhari,\u201d Krishna told him.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>During the battle of\nKurukshetra, Gandhari\u2019s hundred sons were all killed by the Pandavas. She was\nheartbroken. After the battle, she said to Krishna, \u201cYou do not know what\nsuffering I am going through! I am cursing you. The same thing will happen to\nyour dear ones. They will quarrel and fight among themselves and they will all\nbe killed.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Krishna said to\nGandhari, \u201cMother, I am not responsible for the deaths of your sons. I begged\nthem not to fight. I begged them to give just five villages to the Pandavas,\nbut they would not listen to me. From the beginning to the end, your sons were\nso undivine.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<i><a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8RzrtT75XrM/U7mP3K7UGZI/AAAAAAAAtSs/9gsZhnVqMLY/s1600/dowvdvdnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-8RzrtT75XrM/U7mP3K7UGZI/AAAAAAAAtSs/9gsZhnVqMLY/s1600/dowvdvdnload.jpg\" width=\"290\" /></a></i></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Gandhari answered him,\n\u201cNo, no! I know you are God. You could have averted this war if you had wanted\nto. You could have saved my children and all my dear ones. But because of your\npartiality for the Pandavas, you did not do it. Therefore, I am cursing you.\nExactly the same thing will happen to you. All your dear ones will kill each\nother.\u201d<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<i><a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-U2dyINm4Uu8/U7mQEBPeTWI/AAAAAAAAtS8/e6xy6Mch8SE/s1600/dowgrnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-U2dyINm4Uu8/U7mQEBPeTWI/AAAAAAAAtS8/e6xy6Mch8SE/s1600/dowgrnload.jpg\" width=\"269\" /></a></i></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Gandhari\u2019s dreadful\ncurse came true and Krishna\u2019s entire clan was destroyed. You may ask how\nGandhari could curse someone as great as Krishna. The fact is that Krishna\ncould have nullified the curse, but he chose to accept it. His attitude was, if\nyou want to strike me, then strike. &nbsp;His\nlife on earth as Vishu\u2019s ninth avatar was done with..</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">UNQUOTE -<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rDtPGq1QQBk/U7mYLaEXF7I/AAAAAAAAtTU/sK2lPTcoX7Q/s1600/bashahhhm_grave.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-rDtPGq1QQBk/U7mYLaEXF7I/AAAAAAAAtTU/sK2lPTcoX7Q/s1600/bashahhhm_grave.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not all the white\nhistorian lied on the Kamasutra\u2014and did a Doniger or a dastard..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Arthur Llewellyn Basham,&nbsp; British Indologist and author ( The Wonder\nThat was India ) and professor at the School of Oriental and African Studies,\nLondon, has to say this \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;QUOTE --<span style=\"color: blue;\">The erotic life of ancient India was\ngenerally heterosexual. &nbsp;Homo-sexualism\n(sic) of both sexes was not wholly unknown; it is condemned briefly in the law\nbooks, and the Kama Sutra treats of it, but cursorily, and with little\nenthusiasm. &nbsp;Literature ignores it. &nbsp;In this respect ancient India was far\nhealthier than &nbsp;other ancient cultures </span>---UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Basham had a BA in\nSanskrit from the School of Oriental and African Studies (\"SOAS\")<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/--daHR_Ftr0s/U7mX7ipBcAI/AAAAAAAAtTM/vrZQZsaXlts/s1600/imhhhages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/--daHR_Ftr0s/U7mX7ipBcAI/AAAAAAAAtTM/vrZQZsaXlts/s1600/imhhhages.jpg\" width=\"205\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; In Genoa, Colonel Burton served Queen Caroline, the\nunwanted wife of George IV. She was known for being \"gracious\" to the\nofficers of the garrison and won their loyalty and devotion. When she was\ncalled before the House of Lords on charges of adultery, Colonel Burton was\nsummoned to testify. When he refused to do so, he was dismissed from his post\nat half pay- UNQUOTE .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regarding Richard\nFrancis Burton\u2019s written report on Karachi\u2019s homosexual and transversite\nbrother&nbsp; to Gen Napier .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE \u2013 Almost all the\npeople who read the report criticized Burton. They believed that the only way a\nreport with such intimate particulars could have been written was if he had\nengaged in, not merely observed, the homosexual activities. &nbsp;Throughout the remainder of his life, rumors\ncirculated regarding his homosexual escapades in India. &nbsp;More than any other individual, John Henning\nSpeke, the army lieutenant with whom Burton had an adversarial relationship,\nspread these rumors through his written reports back to their commanders- UNQUOTE\n&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE- In 1855, Burton\nrejoined the army and traveled to the Crimea hoping to see active service in\nthe Crimean War. He served on the staff of Beatson's Horse a corps of\nBashi-bazouks, local fighters under the command of General Beatson, in the\nDardanelles. The corps was disbanded following a \"mutiny\" after they\nrefused to obey orders and Burton's name was mentioned ( to his detriment ) in\nthe subsequent inquiry.-UNQUOTE&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE - Speke again\naccompanied him and on 27 June 1857 they set out from the east coast of Africa\nheading west in search of the lake or lakes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The expedition arrived\nat Lake Tanganyika in February 1858. Burton was awestruck by the sight of the\nmagnificent lake, but Speke, ( temporarily blinded by a disease (sic)&nbsp; ) , was unable to see the body of water. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Royal Geographical\nSociety awarded Speke its Gold Medal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A prolonged public\nquarrel followed, damaging the reputations of both Burton and Speke. As the years\nwent by, [Burton] would neglect no opportunity to deride and undermine Speke's\ngeographical theories and achievements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Royal Geographical\nSociety awarded Speke its Gold Medal. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 16 September 1864,\nBurton and Speke were scheduled to debate the source of the Nile at a meeting\nof the British Association for the Advancement of Science. The Sage suggested the worship of a tantric goddess Tara that spread\ntowards the eastern Himalayan belt till the Garo Hills where the tribals\nworshipped a fertility 'yoni' goddess 'Kameke'.
