font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here are some gems \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By making this woman my\nfriend I shall gain the object of some friend of mine, or shall be able to\neffect the ruin of some enemy, or shall accomplish some other difficult\npurpose.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By being united with\nthis woman, I shall kill her husband, and so obtain his vast riches which I\ncovet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The husband of this\nwoman has violated the chastity of my wives, I shall therefore return that injury\nby seducing his wives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My enemy is a friend of\nthis woman's husband, I shall therefore cause her to join him, and will thus\ncreate an enmity between her husband and him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Man is divided into\nthree classes, viz., the hare man, the bull man, and the horse man, according\nto the size of his lingam.( &nbsp;<i>yes of course , the dastard went around\nmeasuring pricks</i> ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Woman also, according\nto the depth of her yoni, is either a female deer, a mare, or a female\nelephant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The horse and mare, the\nbull and deer, form the high union, while the horse and deer form the highest\nunion. On the female side, the elephant and bull, the mare and hare, form low\nunions, while the elephant and the hare make the lowest unions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a man enjoys many\nwomen altogether, it is called the \"congress of a herd of cows.\" &nbsp;TEE HEEEEE !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Striking is of four\nkinds, viz.:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Striking with the back\nof the hand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Striking with the\nfingers a little contracted.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Striking with the fist.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Striking with the open\npalm of the hand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hey, how about a nice\nKarate chop with a Kung Fu chop thrown in for good measure ? &nbsp;Oh I forgot Maharishi Vatsa did NOT know\nKarate.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Besides these, there\nare also words having a meaning, such as \"mother,\" and those that are\nexpressive of prohibition, sufficiency, desire of liberation, pain or praise,\nand to which may be added sounds like those of the dove, the cuckoo, the green\npigeon, the parrot, the bee, the sparrow, the flamingo, the duck, and the\nquail, which are all occasionally made use of.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hey, how about a red hen\n?</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blows with the fist\nshould be given on the back of the woman, while she is sitting on the lap of\nthe man, and she should give blows in return, abusing the man as if she were\nangry, and making the cooing and the weeping sounds. While the woman is engaged\nin congress the space between the breasts should be struck with the back of the\nhand, slowly at first, and then proportionately to the increasing excitement,\nuntil the end.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Oh boy ! &nbsp;Did a maharishi tell all this ?</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At this time the sounds\nHin and others may be made, alternately or optionally, according to habit. When\nthe man, making the sound Ph\u00e2t, strikes the woman on the head, with the fingers\nof his hand a little contracted, it is called Prasritaka, which means striking\nwith the fingers of the hand a little contracted. In this case the appropriate\nsounds are the cooing sound, the sound Ph\u00e2t, and the sound Phut in the interior\nof the mouth, and at the end of congress the sighing and weeping sounds. The\nsound Ph\u00e2t is an imitation of the sound of a bamboo being split, while the\nsound Phut is like the sound made by something falling into water. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hey, how about sound of\ncanvas being torn? Say KRRRRRRR ?</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">At all times when kissing and such like things are begun, the woman should give a reply with a hissing sound. During the excitement when the woman is not accustomed to striking, she continually utters words expressive of prohibition, sufficiently, or desire of liberation, as well as the words \"father,\" \"mother,\" intermingled with the sighing, weeping and thundering sounds. Towards the conclusion of the congress, the breasts, the jaghana, and the sides of the woman should be pressed with the open palms of the hand, with some force, until the end of it, and then sounds like those of the quail, or the goose should be made.</span><br />\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"line-height: 24px;\"><i>Hey, what is sauce for the goose, &nbsp;aint so for the gander ? So we are a stupid race, &nbsp;right?</i></span><br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anybody who want to\nfind out what is \u201ccongress of the crow\u201d can send an fax to Doniger or the\ndastard .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a girl cannot meet\nher lover frequently in private, she should send the daughter of her nurse to\nhim, it being understood that she has confidence in her relations. She should\nalso quote samples of many girls of ancient times, such as Sakuntala and\nothers, who, having united themselves with lovers of their own caste and their\nown choice, were ever happy afterwards in their society.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Note: The immoral white\ninvader created a FAKE and backdated Kalidasa , to show that he existed before\nthey came to India \u2013 he wrote a play about the FAKE Shakuntala and her son\nBharat, and thus converted India ( Bharat ) as a very late entity.</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the country of the\nVaidarbhas the sons of the royal ladies enter the royal harem when they please,\nand enjoy the women, with the exception of their own mothers. In the Stri-rajya\nthe wives of the King are enjoyed by his caste fellows and relations. In the\nGanda country the royal wives are enjoyed by Brahmans, friends, servants, and\nslaves. In the Samdhava country, servants, foster children, and other persons\nlike them enjoy the women of the harem. In the country of the Haimavatas\nadventurous citizens bribe the sentinels and enter the harem. In the country of\nthe Vanyas and the Kalmyas, Brahmans, with the knowledge of the King, enter the\nharem under the pretence of giving flowers to the ladies, and speak with them\nfrom behind a curtain, and from such conversation union afterwards takes place.\nLastly, the women in the harem of the King of the Prachyas conceal one young\nman in the harem for every batch of nine or ten of the women.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Hey , how about KUNDI\ncountry \u2013 ( in Malayalam Kundi means as$hole )</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here are Kamasutra chapters\n5 and 6 contents , of Doniger and the dastard .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. Paradarikadhikaranam\n- About the wives of other people; On Extra Marital Relations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chapters on behavior of\nwoman and man, encounters to get acquainted, examination of sentiments, the\ntask of go-between, the king's pleasures, behavior in the women's quarters (6 chapters).\nThis section of the Kama Sutra consisted of six chapters on behavior of women\nand men. It included advice on the methods of seducing another mans wife,\nincluding encounters for getting acquainted, examination of sentiments, the\ntasks and advantages of go-betweens, the king\u2019s pleasures such as his harem and\nways the brave could circumvent security measures and enjoy those pleasures\nthemselves, as well as the proper behavior of a Hindu gentleman in the\ngynoecium or womens apartments. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. Vaishikam - About\ncourtesans<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chapters on advice of\nthe assistants on the choice of lovers, looking for a steady lover, ways of\nmaking money, renewing friendship with a former lover, occasional profits,\nprofits and losses (6 chapters). Section Six of the Kama Sutra consisted of six\nchapters on making the best use of the advice of the assistants on choosing\nlovers, the search for a steady lover, the courtesans skill set and ways of\nmaking money, how best to renew friendship with a former lover, creating\noccasional profits and dealing with profits and losses associated with being a\ncourtesan.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the muffs ,here\nare the lost Kama works<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra of Nandi or Nandikeshvara. (1000\nchapters)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra of Auddalaki Shvetaketu (500\nchapters)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra or B\u00e2bhravyak\u00e2rik\u00e2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra of Ch\u00e2r\u00e2yana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra of Ghotakamukha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra of Gonard\u00eeya<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra of Gonik\u00e2putra<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra of Dattaka. According to the\nlegend, the author Dattaka was transformed into a woman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;* K\u00e2mash\u00e2stra or Ratinirnaya of Suvarnan\u00e2bha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hey, we must thank\nDoniger&nbsp; and the dastard for bringing us\nfrom darkness to light..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">WANNA READ SOME AUTHENTIC MAHARISHI\nVATSA STUFF ? </b></span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THIS IS WHAT MAKES A BHARATIYA\nNAARI . &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">THIS IS NOT FOR CHUTNET MARYs WHO WATCH THE\nBOLD AND THE BEAUTIFUL.</span></b><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">QUOTE: A virtuous woman, who has\naffection for her husband, should act in conformity with his wishes as if he\nwere a divine being, and with his consent should take upon herself the whole\ncare of his family. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">She should keep the whole house\nwell cleaned, and arrange flowers of various kinds in different parts of it,\nand make the floor smooth and polished so as to give the whole a neat and\nbecoming appearance. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">She should surround the house with\na garden, and place ready in it all the materials required for the morning,\nnoon and even sacrifices. Moreover she should herself revere the sanctuary of\nthe Household Gods, &nbsp;\"nothing so\nmuch attracts the heart of a householder to his wife as a careful observance of\nthe things mentioned above.\"<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Towards the parents, relations,\nfriends, sisters, and servants of her husband she should behave as they\ndeserve. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">In the garden she should plant beds\nof green vegetables, bunches of the sugar cane, and clumps of the fig tree, the\nmustard plant, the parsley plant, the fennel plant, and the xanthochymus\npictorius. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Clusters of various flowers, such\nas the trapa bispinosa, the jasmine, the gasminum grandiflorum, the yellow\namaranth, the wild jasmine, the tabernamontana coronaria, the nadyaworta, the\nchina rose and others, should likewise be planted, together with the fragrant\ngrass andropogon sch\u00e6nanthus, and the fragrant root of the plant andropogon\nmiricatus. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">She should also have seats and\narbours made in the garden, in the middle of which a well, tank, or pool should\nbe dug.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The wife should always avoid the\ncompany of female beggars, female buddish mendicants, unchaste and roguish\nwomen, female fortune tellers and witches. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">As regards meals she should always\nconsider what her husband likes and dislikes, and what things are good for him,\nand what are injurious to him. When she hears the sounds of his footsteps\ncoming home she should at once get up, and be ready to do whatever he may\ncommand her, and either order her female servant to wash his feet, or wash them\nherself. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">When going anywhere with her\nhusband, she should put on her ornaments, and without his consent she should\nnot either give or accept invitations, or attend marriages and sacrifices, or\nsit in the company of female friends, or visit the temples of the Gods. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">And if she wants to engage in any\nkind of games or sports, she should not do it against his will. In the same way\nshe should always sit down after him, and get up before him, and should never\nawaken him when he is asleep. The kitchen should be situated in a quiet and\nretired place, so as not to be accessible to strangers, and should always look\nclean.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">In the event of any misconduct on\nthe part of her husband, she should not blame him excessively though she be a\nlittle displeased. She should not use abusive language towards him, but rebuke\nhim with conciliatory words, whether he be in the company of friends or alone.\nMoreover, she should not be a scold, &nbsp;\"there is no cause of dislike on the part\nof a husband so great as this characteristic in a wife.\" <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">Lastly she should avoid bad\nexpressions, sulky looks, speaking aside, standing in the doorway, and looking\nat passers-by, conversing in the pleasure groves, and remaining in a lonely\nplace for a long time; and finally she should always keep her body, her teeth,\nher hair, and everything belonging to her tidy, sweet, and clean.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">When the wife wants to approach her\nhusband in private her dress should consist of many ornaments, various kinds of\nflowers, and a cloth decorated with different colours, and some sweet-smelling\nointments or unguents. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">But her every-day dress should be\ncomposed of a thin, close-textured cloth, a few ornaments and flowers, and a\nlittle scent, not too much. She should also observe the fasts and vows of her\nhusband, and when he tries to prevent her doing this, she should persuade him\nto let her do it.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">At appropriate times of the year,\nand when they happen to be cheap, she should buy earth, bamboos, firewood,\nskins, and iron pots, as also salt and oil. Fragrant substances, vessels made\nof the fruit of the plant wrightea antidysenterica, or oval leaved wrightea,\nmedicines, and other things which are always wanted, should be obtained when\nrequired and kept in a secret place of the house. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The seeds of the radish, the\npotato, the common beet, the Indian wormwood, the mangoe, the cucumber, the egg\nplant, the kushmanda, the pumpkin gourd, the surana, the bignonia indica, the\nsandal wood, the premna spinosa, the garlic plant, the onion, and other\nvegetables, should be bought and sown at the proper seasons.<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The wife, moreover, should not tell\nto strangers the amount of her wealth, nor the secrets which her husband has\nconfided to her. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">She should surpass all the women of\nher own rank in life in her cleverness, her appearance, her knowledge of\ncookery, her pride, and her manner of serving her husband. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The expenditure of the year should\nbe regulated by the profits. The milk that remains after the meals should be\nturned into ghee or clarified butter. Oil and sugar should be prepared at home;\nspinning and weaving should also be done there; and a store of ropes and cords,\nand barks of trees for twisting into ropes should be kept. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">She should also attend to the\npounding and cleaning of rice, using its small grain and chaff in some way or\nother. She should pay the salaries of the servants, look after the tilling of\nthe fields, and keeping of the flocks and herds, superintend the making of\nvehicles, and take care of the rams, cocks, quails, parrots, starlings,\ncuckoos, peacocks, monkeys, and deer; and finally adjust the income and\nexpenditure of the day. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The worn-out clothes should be\ngiven to those servants who have done good work, in order to show them that\ntheir services have been appreciated, or they may be applied to some other use.\n<o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The vessels in which wine is\nprepared, as well as those in which it is kept, should be carefully looked\nafter, and put away at the proper time. All sales and purchases should also be\nwell attended to. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">The friends of her husband she\nshould welcome by presenting them with flowers, ointment, incense, betel\nleaves, and betel nut. Her father-in-law and mother-in law she should treat as\nthey deserve, always remaining dependant on their will, never contradicting\nthem, speaking to them in few and not harsh words, not laughing loudly in their\npresence, and acting with their friends and enemies as with her own. <o:p></o:p></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\">In addition to the above she should\nnot be vain, or too much taken up with her enjoyments. She should be liberal\ntowards her servants, and reward them on holidays and festivals; and not give\naway anything without first making it known to her husband. UNQUOTE<o:p></o:p></span></i><br />\n<i><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></i>\n<i><span style=\"color: red;\">Below: Calicut is my hometown , I know more about Nilgiris ( blue mountains ) than the dastard.</span></i><br />\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OuD2VOw_Dbg/U7uNR-BM0VI/AAAAAAAAtZU/lpYkgEFbMZk/s1600/schkan0017.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OuD2VOw_Dbg/U7uNR-BM0VI/AAAAAAAAtZU/lpYkgEFbMZk/s1600/schkan0017.jpg\" width=\"425\" /></a></div>\n<i><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></i>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">The following are the\narts to be studied, together with the Kama Sutra:<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"color: magenta; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: magenta; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">* Singing</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Playing on musical instruments<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Dancing<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;*\nWriting and drawing<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Tattooing with mehndi<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Arraying and adorning an idol with rice and\nflowers<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Spreading and arranging beds or couches of\nflowers, or flowers upon the ground<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Colouring the teeth, garments, hair, nails\nand bodies, i.e. staining, dyeing, colouring and painting the same<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Fixing stained glass into a floor<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* The art of making beds, and spreading out\ncarpets and cushions for reclining<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Playing on musical glasses filled with water<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">* Picture making,\ntrimming and decorating<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Stringing of rosaries, necklaces, garlands\nand wreaths<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">* Art of preparing\nperfumes and odours<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Proper disposition of jewels and\ndecorations, and adornment in dress<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;*\nQuickness of hand or manual skill<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Culinary art, i.e. cooking and cookery<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Making lemonades, sherbets, acidulated\ndrinks with proper flavour and colour<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Tailor's work and sewing<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Making parrots, flowers, tufts, tassels,\nbunches, bosses, knobs, etc., out of yarn or thread<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Solution of riddles, enigmas, covert\nspeeches, verbal puzzles and enigmatical questions<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* A game, which consisted in repeating verses,\nand as one person finished, another person had to commence at once, repeating\nanother verse, beginning with the same letter with which the last speaker's\nverse ended, whoever failed to repeat was considered to have lost, and to be\nsubject to pay a forfeit or stake of some kind ( modern antakshari )<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* The art of mimicry or imitation<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Reading, including chanting and intoning<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Study of sentences difficult to pronounce.\nIt is played as a game chiefly by women, and children and consists of a\ndifficult sentence being given, and when repeated quickly, the words are often\ntransposed or badly pronounced<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Practice with sword, single stick, quarter\nstaff and bow and arrow<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Drawing inferences, reasoning or inferring<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;*\nKnowledge about gold and silver coins, and jewels and gems<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Chemistry and mineralogy<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Colouring jewels, gems and beads<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;*\nGardening; knowledge of treating the diseases of trees and plants, of\nnourishing them, and determining their ages<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* &nbsp;Art\nof teaching parrots and starlings to speak<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Art of applying perfumed ointments to the\nbody, and of dressing the hair with unguents and perfumes and braiding it<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* The art of understanding writing in cypher,\nand the writing of words in a peculiar way<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* The art of speaking by changing the forms of\nwords. It is of various kinds. Some speak by changing the beginning and end of\nwords, others by adding unnecessary letters between every syllable of a word,\nand so on<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Knowledge of language and of the vernacular\ndialects<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Art of making flower carriages<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Art of framing mystical diagram yantras, of\naddressing spells and charms, and binding armlets<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Mental exercises, such as completing stanzas\nor verses on receiving a part of them; or supplying one, two or three lines\nwhen the remaining lines are given indiscriminately from different verses, so\nas to make the whole an entire verse with regard to its meaning; or arranging\nthe words of a verse written irregularly by separating the vowels from the\nconsonants, or leaving them out altogether; or putting into verse or prose\nsentences represented by signs or symbols. There are many other such exercises.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Composing poems<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Knowledge of dictionaries and vocabularies<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Knowledge of ways of changing and disguising\nthe appearance of persons<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Knowledge of the art of changing the\nappearance of things, such as making cotton to appear as silk, coarse and\ncommon things to appear as fine and good<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">* Skill in youthful\nsports<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Knowledge of the rules of society, and of\nhow to pay respect and compliments to others<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">&nbsp;* Knowledge of the art of war, of arms, of armies,\netc.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">* Art of knowing the\ncharacter of a man from his features<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">QUOTE-Burton died in\nTrieste early on the morning of 20 October 1890 of a heart attack. . On his\nreligious views, Burton called himself an atheist. Isabel never recovered from\nthe loss. After his death she burned many of her husband's papers, including\njournals and a planned new translation of The Perfumed Garden to be called The\nScented Garden, for which she had been offered six thousand guineas and which she\nregarded as his \"magnum opus\". font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u00b7</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">&nbsp;\n<b><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/08173368436479307173\"><span style=\"color: #888888;\">Anurag Shukla</span></a></b><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/01/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_8.html?showComment=1515577636725#c1355131828973993083\"><span style=\"color: #888888;\">January 10, 2018 at 3:17 PM</span></a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: 6.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Follow your inner voice. When reading bhaja govindam\npreviously, even I did not fee comfortable with the first verse saying \"</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u092e\u094d\u092a\u094d\u0930\u093e\u092a\u094d\u0924\u0947</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\".\nThen again the part where a saffron clad Adi Sankara says<br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u091c\u091f\u093f\u0932\u094b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0967\u096a\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nThere are many who go with matted locks, many who have clean<br />\nshaven heads, many whose hairs have been plucked out; some are<br />\nclothed in orange, yet others in various colours --- all just for<br />\na livelihood.<br />\n<br />\nHow can a saint himself deride saints like this? Even if there are black sheep,\nwill he write a verse deriding all sadhus?<br />\n<br />\nAgain in Hanuman Chalisa - even when reading it aloud, I could not get myself\nto say these lines -<br />\n<br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0914\u0930</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0928</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0927\u0930\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0938\u0941\u0916</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0915\u0930\u0908</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965\u0969\u096b\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nI will not keep any other God in my heart, except Hanuman.<br />\nSo I will not even remember Ram/Vishnu (even though Hanuman himself worships\nRam)?<br />\n<br />\nThis never felt right.<br />\n<br />\nAs soon as Ajit ji wrote this, it was a Eureka moment.<br />\n<br />\nMany thanks, Ajit ji.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\nl\u012blyo t\u0101hi madhura phala j\u0101n\u016b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> 18 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nThe Surya, sun was swallowed by you after you assumed him to be a sweet fruit.\nBALLS --RIDICULOUS<br />\n<br />\njo shata b\u0101ra p\u0101tha kara ko\u012b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> chh\u016btahi bandi mah\u0101 sukha ho\u012b</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> 38 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nOne who recites Hanuman Chalisa a hundred times (or for hundred days) is\nreleased from bondage ( MOKSHA ) and obtains great bliss\". BALLS !<br />\n<br />\njo yaha parhai hanum\u0101na ch\u0101l\u012bs\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> hoya siddha s\u0101kh\u012b gaur\u012bs\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> 39 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nOne who reads this Hanuman Chalisa obtains Siddhi (accomplishment or\nliberation). Shiva himself bears witness to this statement-- BALLS !<br />\n<br />\ntulas\u012bd\u0101sa sad\u0101 hari cher\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> k\u012bjai n\u0101tha hridaya maha der\u0101</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> 40 </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nTulsidas is always a devotee of Hari. O Lord, make my heart your abode.<br />\n-- CHOOT TULSIDAS NEVER EXISTED<br />\n<br />\npavantanaya sankata harana mangala m\u016brati r\u016bpa</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0964</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"> r\u0101ma lakhan s\u012bt\u0101 sahita hridaya basahu sura bh\u016bpa</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;mangal&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">\u0965</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br />\n<br />\nO Son of V\u0101yu, remover of adversities, one with an auspicious form, and the\nchief among all Devas, may you reside in our hearts along with Rama, Lakshman\nand Sita-- BALLS HANUMAN IS CHIEF AMONG DEVAS--HE IS JUST A MONKEY IN RAMAYANA.\nRAMA IS THE GOD.. WE HAVE RAMA IDOLS IN TEMPLES<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: x-large;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span></b><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4184446395271055880\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_78M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. text-decoration-line: none;\">January 29, 2018 at 4:49 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_78MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">ONE OF MY READERS CALLED ME UP<br /><br />HE SAID\u2014 IT TOOK ME PART 92 OF SANATANA DHARMA SERIES TO REALLY COMPEHEND WHY YOU NAMED IT \u201cEXHUMED AND RESURRECTED\u201d<br /><br />HE SAID NOW HE KNOWS ADI SHANKARACHARYA SHORED UP A SINKING SANATANA DHARMA IN 2000 BC, AND NOW A RETIRED SHIP CAPTAIN , A BLOOGER NAMED CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL HAS EXHUMED A SUNK SANATANA DHARMA\u20144000 YEARS LATER.<br /><br />THAT , BY THE TIME JEW ROTHSCHILD LEFT INDIA IN 1947 HE FOOLED HINDUS, TO MAKE THEM SELF LOATHING, TO CONVERT AND TO DIVIDE AND RULE<br /><br />AAA- HINDUS WERE FOOLED INTO BELEIVING THAT WE ARE IDOLATORS , WHILE OUR ORIGINAL GOD IS THE CONSCIOUSNESS FIELD OF BRAHMAN WHICH CANNOT BE PICKED UP BY THE 5 HUMAN SENSES<br /><br />BBB- OUR GODS ARE NOT MORTAL \u2014 BUT AMAZING COMIC ALLEGORIES ( EXCEPT VISHNU AVATARS MORTALS WITH 13 STRAND DNA RAMA/ KRISHNA AYYAPPA )<br /><br />CCC- OUR GODS INSIDE TEMPLES ARE ONLY A HANDFUL\u2014 SHIVA AND HIS WIFE PARVATI ( SHAKTI / DEVI/ BHAGAVATI/ KALI/ DURGA ), BRAHMA AND HIS WIFE SARASWATI, VISHNU AND HIS WIFE LAXMI, SHIVAs SONS GANAPATI AND KARTIKEYA<br /><br />DDD- JEW ROTHSCHILD GAVE US 330 MILLION FAKE GODS, THE LAST BEING A UNWASHED MUSLIM MAN SHIRDI SAI BABA WHO DIED 99 YEARS AGO\u2014WHOSE PHOTOS EXIST.<br /><br />EEE- NORTH INDIANS WERE FOOLED INTO MARRYING AT NIGHT AND WORSHIPPING WHITE STATUES ( INSTEAD OF SMALL BLACK STONE IDOLS DULY CONSECRATED )</span></div>\n</div>\n<b style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\">LLL- THAT ALMOST ALL OUR BHARAT RATNAS AND HEROES ARE ROTHSCHILD AGENTS \u2013 OR COOKED UP ONES ( LIKE THE BHAKTI MOVEMENT HEROES ). You see Chaitanya baby revealed to Goswami baby that he is an avatar of Krishna ( BALLS !)<br />\n<br />\nGoswami baby created the Radha Raman Temple--which was actually an old Vishnu temple retro installed -- with a shaligram deity of Krishna alongside Radharani.<br />\n<br />\nI WANT MY READERS TO SPREAD THE TRUTH<br />\n<br />\nHARE RAMA OF THE CHANT BY ISKON -- HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH SRI RAM.<br />\n<br />\nCHANTING THIS BULLSHIT MANTRA OF HARE RAMA ( RADHA ) HARE KRISHA DOES YOU NO GOOD<br />\n<br />\nRadha-vallabha is another fake sect--where Krishna is called the consort of Radha. Here Radha is the deity-- Krishna is just a side-kick<br />\n<br />\nShri Radhavallabhlal temple at Vrindavan was a Vishnu temple converted to Radha and Krishna idol - a 2 in 1 .<br />\n<br />\nIN SANKHYA JEW ROTHSCHILD HAS USED HIS AGENTS LIKE PRABHUPADA TO SUBSTITUTE SHIVA / SHAKTI -------WITH KRISHNA ( A MERE AVATAR OF VISHNU ) AND A FAKE MISTRESS RADHA .<br />\n<br />\nPOISON INJECTED VERSES BELOW--<br />\n<br />\nradha purna-sakti, krsna purna-saktiman<br />\ndui vastu bheda nai, sastra-paramana<br />\nmrgamada, tara gandha yaiche aviccheda<br />\nagni, jvalate yaiche kabhu nahi bheda<br />\nradha-krsna aiche sada eka-i svarupa<br />\nlila-rasa asvadite dhare dui-rupa<br />\n<br />\nSri Radha is the full energy, and Lord Krsna is the possessor of full power.<br />\n<br />\nThe two are not different, as evidenced by the revealed scriptures. They are indeed the same, just as musk and its scent are inseparable, or as fire and its heat are nondifferent. Thus Radha and Lord Krsna are one, yet They have taken two forms to enjoy the mellows of pastimes. (Cc. Adi 4.96-98)<br />\n<br />\nisvarera sakti haya e-tina prakara<br />\neka laksmi-gana, pure mahisi-gana ara<br />\nvraje gopi-gana ara sabhate pradhana<br />\nvrajendra-nandana ya'te svayam bhagavan<br />\n<br />\nThe energies (consorts) of the Supreme Lord are of three kinds: the Laksmis in Vaikuntha, the queens in Dvaraka, and the gopis in Vrndavana. The gopis are the best of all, for they have the privilege of serving Sri Krsna, the primeval Lord, the son of the King of Vraja (Cc. Adi 1.79,80)<br />\n<br />\nSORRY -- All this bull about Radha being a mistress of Lord Krishna and all his thousands of Gopikas whom he flirted with , are all poisons injected into Hinduism by the white Christian invader. Kalidas who invented Radha never existed. Krishna did NOT have 16000 virgin gopikas in vrindavan rather 16000 are dhatus of shasrara chakra . SAHASRARA CHAKRA is a 1000 petalled lotus -- each with 16 kalas or aspects --this works out to 16000 .<br />\n<br />\nthis is NOT some girl who has sex with Lord Krishna --taking turns to HUMP.<br />\n<br />\nNarakasura kidnapped 16000 damsels --and Lord Krishna saved these damsels in distress. this is just an allegory.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_56MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_56BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_56B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_57B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5759304704119782162\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_57M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. THE SOULS OF CRIMINALS/ HOMOSEXUALS WHO HAVE NO CONSCIENCE ARE IN THE LAYER..<br />\n<br />\nSECOND TO SIXTH LAYERS ARE MEANT ONLY FOR CONSCIOUS HUMANS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER MEANT FOR SOULS WITH LOWEST FREQUENCY ( HIGH NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ) AND THE SIXTH ASTRAL HAVING PARKING SPACE FOR SOULS OF HIGHER FREQUENCY ( LOW NEGATIVE KARMIC BAGGAGE ).<br />\n<br />\nYAMA IS IN CHARGE OF LAYERS TWO TO SIX..<br />\n<br />\nALL SOULS IN FIRST TO SIXTH ASTRAL LAYERS --AWAIT RE-BIRTH.<br />\n<br />\nSEVENTH ASTRAL LAYER IS THE FIELD OF BRAHMAN ( VAIKUNTA ).. HERE ONLY MOKSHA SOULS -- NIL EGO, NIL KRAMIC BAGGAGE AND HIGHEST SOULD FREQUENCY ( SAME AS MOTHER FIELD BRAHMAN ) CAN ENTER --TO BE MERGED WITH BRAHMAN ( GOD )..<br />\n<br />\nONLY SOULS CAN ENTER ALL SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS --NOT THE PHYSICAL BODY ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE RASCAL SADUGU JAGGI VASUDEV LIES ABOUT PLENTY FOOD TO EAT AND APSARAS FOR SEX IN SEVENTH LAYER .. BALLS !<br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE 5 PANDAVA BROTHERS AND DRAUPADI DECIDE TO CLIMB MOUNT MERU --IT IS AN ALLEGORY FOR DEATH AND SOULS PARKING AT ONE OF THE SEVEN ASTRAL LAYERS<br />\n<br />\nYAMA ( DHARMA ) IN THE FORM OF A DOG JOINS THIS GROUP ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMA USHERS IN --<br />\nDRAUPADI INTO THE SECOND ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nNAKULA INTO THE THIRD ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nSAHADEVA INTO THE FOURTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nBHIMA INTO THE FIFTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\nARJUNA INTO THE SIXTH ASTRAL LAYER<br />\n<br />\nAND THEN YUDHISTRA LOOKS BACK AND SEES THE DOG.. HE KNOWS THAT NO DOG CAN GET PAST THE FIRST ASTRAL LAYER --AND HE IS PUZZLED..<br />\n<br />\nAT THE SEVENT ASTRAL LAYER ( EQUIVALENT OF HEAVEN ) YUDDHISTRA SEES ALL HUNDRED KAURAVAS ALREADY THERE -- ALONG WITH THE STALWARTS LIKE BHISHMA/ DRONA /KARNA ETC<br />\n<br />\nHE IS SHOCKED AND ANGRY<br />\n<br />\nAT THAT TIME YAMA ( THE DOORKEEPER OF ASTRAL LAYERS 2 TO 6 ) DECLARES THAT HE IS YUDDHISTRAs FATHER WITH KUNTI .. AND THAT YUDDHISTRA STILL HAS SEEDS OF EGO WITHIN HIMS WHICH MAKES HIM UNFIT FOR MOKSHA ..<br />\n<br />\nYAMAs EXPLANATION: WHOEVER KRISHNA KILLED --ALL GOT MOKSHA .. KRISHNA HAD THE UNWRITTEN TASK OF KILLING ALL 100 TEST TUBE KAURAVA BABIES-- HE DID IT AND HOW..<br />\n<br />\nPANDAVAS WOULD HAVE HAD ALBINO BLOOD OF MOTHER KUNTI HAS SEX WITH PANDU ( AN ALBINO )--AND IN THAT CASE KRISHNA WOULD HAVE KILLED ALL 5 PANDAVAS TOO..<br />\n<br />\nBeautiful and intelligent Queen Kunti was the mother of Karna and the first three Pandava brothers Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna. .<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_179BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; Sanskrit has no script till date. It depends upon the script of other languages. Tamil has the script very long back . It has been proved by the excavations conducted in various places including Egypt and Thailand. Jaffna site is one among those in which Tamil script was found used during BC 1500 Years. The word Thirazh muri which means an agenda approved in a meeting. Such a valid proof is available for Tamil Language.No other language has such a valid proof as Tamil has. Except Asokas script in India all other scripts are found during Guptas period only. In Asoka's script was not used to write Sanskrit. So all the Sanskrit literatures were written around A.D. 4 th century. But Thirukural was written during BC 2 nd century . As such how this gentleman Nagasamy does claim that Thirukural is the copy of Artha Sastra. Same philosophy may reflect in different literatures. Only timeline will decide which one is copied from which one. Is is not humour a language which has not script at all can be taken as the pioneer for all other literatures of other language Tamil Which has the script discovered before 3500 years. TEE HEEEE !<br />\n<br />\nIt is comprised of 1330 pairs each with exactly 7 words.<br />\n<br />\nThere are 133 chapters and 3 parts. The 3 main parts are:<br />\nAram (Dharma / Justice)<br />\nPorul (Artha / Wealth &amp; Power)<br />\nInbam (Kamam / Love &amp; Sex).<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThe book on A\u1e5fam (virtue) contains 380 verses, that of Poru\u1e37 (wealth) has 700 and that of Inbam ( kama sex) has 250.<br />\nThere are two parts of Thirukkural's Kama<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--<br />\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_164MN\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_164BR\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_164B_box\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_165B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8235661969138140139\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_165M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/henry-ford-victim-of-jewish-retribution_6.html?showComment=1525741329647#c8235661969138140139\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 8, 2018 at 6:32 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_165MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nKalaviyal - This goes into a secret love (or pre-marital love or affair). There are plenty of tips on how to recognize the signs of love and how to impress the lover. It also goes into what it likes to miss a lover and how to embrace the right way.<br />\nInteresting quotes:<br />\nIt is difficult to understand<br />\nThe essence of the knight is the shoulder<br />\nThis girl has the elixir in her shoulders. Whenever I hug her, I get reborn.<br />\n<br />\nMedication for dysfunction<br />\nThe medicine itself is for self<br />\nThere is medicine for every illness. But for the one who is missing his lover, there can not be better than meeting his love.<br />\n<br />\nI do not know how to look<br />\nYambatta Thambata River<br />\nIf you are laughing at someone else's love and pulling his legs, it is because you never never in love.<br />\n<br />\n2. Karpiyal - This goes into the marital love. These 18 chapters come at the end of the book and deals with separation, anger, memories, complaining and feigned anger.<br />\n<br />\nYerunangan lover of love<br />\nNo one is anyone<br />\nWhen I say to her that she is dear to me than everybody, she still asks me whom I compare her with.<br />\n<br />\nOthers do not care<br />\nEye to eye<br />\nThe person who stole my heart does not seem to be interested in hugging me. I can not even find him. This is breaking my heart.<br />\n<br />\nChapter entitled \"Prostitutes\": For gold, not love their tongue cajoles men are ruined by bangled belles (911)<br />\nThe false embrance of whores is like that of a damned corpse in the dark {913)<br />\n(allusion to necrophilia,a rare sexual deviation)<br />\nThiruvalluvar considers sexuality broadly under two headings \"Courting in secrecy\" and \"Chaste married life\"<br />\nOn this banglod beauty dwell the joys of sight sound touch taste smell (1101)<br />\nJoy is the fast embrace that doth not admit even air between both (1108)<br />\nIn the fore - play the beauty of the woman is extolled in many places:--<br />\n\"Beauty extolled\"<br />\nThe bamboo shouldered has pearl like smiles Fragrant breath and lance like eyes (1J13)<br />\nThe soft flower and the swan's down are like nettles to the feet of the fair.. (1120)<br />\nA sensuous kiss between the lovers is alluded to here:--<br />\nLike milk and honey the dew is sweet from her white teeth whose word is soft (1121)<br />\nLove between me and this lady is like bond between soul and body (1122)<br />\nLife with my jewel is existence Death is is severance (1124)<br />\nAs knowledge reveals past ignorance So is the belle on love gets close ..(1110)<br />\nHe comes; no sleep; he goes; no sleep; This is the fate of eyes that weep .(II79)<br />\nNights' mercy lulls all souls to sleep keeping but me for companionship (1168)<br />\nCrueller than that cruel he are midnight hours gliding slowly (1169)<br />\nOne day seems as sever to those who yearn return of distant spouse (J269)<br />\nIn wakeful hours who sees me not I meet in dreams and linger yet... {1213)<br />\nIn dreams I enjoy his love \u2013 bliss Who in wakeful hours I miss (12 J 4)<br />\nDear life ebbs away by thought of him who said we are one heart {1209)<br />\nThink of, O heart, some remedy To cure this chronic malady {1241)<br />\nFrets to gain and fears loss in gain O my heart suffers ceaseless pain.. {1295)<br />\nThese arms that swelled on nuptial day Now shrunk proclaim \"He is away\"{1233)<br />\nBereft of bracelets and old beauty Arms tell the cruel's cruelty {1235)<br />\n<br />\nMy eyes causing lust more than sea Suffer that tortune slecplessly (1175)<br />\nHe seized my beauty and modesty Leaving pangs and pallor to me ... {1183)<br />\nLover away, comes even tide like slayer to field of homicide {1224)<br />\nSulking is the salt of love : but too much of it spoils the taste {1302)<br />\nSulking is lover's delight Its delight grows when they write {1330)<br />\n<br />\n\"Shall I draw back, or yield myself, or shall both mingled be,<br />\nWhen he returns, my spouse, dear as these eyes to me.\" (Kural 1267)[26]<br />\n\"Withdraw, it burns; approach, it soothes the pain;<br />\nWhence did the maid this wondrous fire obtain?\" (Kural 1104)[27]<br />\n\"A double witchery have glances of her liquid eyes;<br />\nOne glance is glance that brings me pain; the other heals again.\" (Kural 1091)<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_165MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_165BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px;
