font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The practice of unburnt\nbodies being dumped in the river must be stopped and culprits must be traced ,\nfined and imprisoned.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Modi govt must\nconstruct electric crematoriums with double generator power back up.&nbsp; Out of these 25% crematoriums must be FREE\nfor the desperately poor .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Burning wood for cremating bodies must have a heavy\ngovernment surcharge tax , so that Hindus are encouraged to use electric\ncrematoriums.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-hbjtLMtHZGU/U6VZ-wSyJ5I/AAAAAAAAs7Q/RQcBRxQ3Oqg/s1600/burxddning_ghats.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-hbjtLMtHZGU/U6VZ-wSyJ5I/AAAAAAAAs7Q/RQcBRxQ3Oqg/s1600/burxddning_ghats.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Special attention must\nbe paid to the exhaust pipe of the electric furnace. I have detailed it in the\npost below.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>RIP IMPOSSIBLE WITH\nBURIAL, THE WORLD IS GOING BACK TO CREMATION VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The biggest threat to a\nHindu is someone telling him that he will NOT be cremated after his death.&nbsp; Even a hard core well knit unit like LTTE\ndisintegrated after Bro Pirbakaran ( converted Christian ) banned cremation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Varanasi has nearly 100\nghats, steps leading to the banks of River Ganga.&nbsp; Most of the ghats are bathing ghats, while\nothers are used as cremation sites.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many FALSE\ntales associated with these ghats , cooked up by the white invader.&nbsp; For example \u2013&nbsp;\nThe spectacular Dashashwamedh&nbsp; Ghat&nbsp; located close to Vishwanath Temple, is the\nplace where Lord Brahma sacrificed ten horses in a Yagna.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanatana Dharma did NOT\nhave any animal or human sacrifice. All such episodes are FAKE and poison\ninjected into Hindusim to make the Hindu self loathing.. Even the famous\nAshwamedha sacrifice does NOT involve the sacrifice of a white horse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>HOLI CELEBRATIONS ,\nIMMORAL ATTACK ON HINDUISM AND INDIAN CULTURE VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a concept\ncalled Moksha in Hinduism. After death a deserving soul&nbsp; which has NIL karmic baggage is liberated\nfrom the endless cycle of births and rebirths.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Hindusim we bury\nsmall children ( less than 28 weeks ) and jivanmukt holy men , as they do NOT\nhave ego.&nbsp;&nbsp; The body of the \u201crealized\nman\u201d or Jivan Mukt&nbsp; continues to exist\nuntil his karmas and prarabdhas ( greater responsibility ) has worked itself\nout,&nbsp; and then his mortal coil falls away\non his own free will , and he attains Moksha. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>MOKSHA , THE FINAL STOP\nTO ENDLESS CYCLE OF EARTHLY SOJOURNS VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many Bengalis have\nasked me why their favourite &nbsp;Hilsa fish has\ndisappeared from the Ganges. Well, today I will tell them what transpired.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We all think that fish\nkeep swimming around from one place to another. &nbsp;But most species species make only two really\nsignificant journeys in their lives. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first is shortly\nafter birth, when fish move away from their spawning grounds, and the second\noccurs when the fish return to the spawning area to breed and die. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before dams were built\nthe only threats to this life journey was from bigger predators and fishermen,\nbut now, fish face insurmountable barriers in the form of dams. &nbsp;If they can't get back to the spawning\ngrounds, then fish populations dramatically decrease.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">That's where fish\nladders come in (you may also hear them referred to as fish passages or\nfishways). &nbsp;&nbsp;Fish ladders provide a detour route for\nmigrating fish so that they can get over or around a dam that's blocking the\nway. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You may wonder \u2013what the\nfu#k ?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o-EmoKkDbp4/U6WPccjazJI/AAAAAAAAs7w/gW79_e3QWXg/s1600/fish-ladder-1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o-EmoKkDbp4/U6WPccjazJI/AAAAAAAAs7w/gW79_e3QWXg/s1600/fish-ladder-1.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How can a fish climb a effin' ladder ?&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BZnMkf96SUw/U6WPU_UKIrI/AAAAAAAAs7o/aARthxb71oc/s1600/doffggwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"425\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-BZnMkf96SUw/U6WPU_UKIrI/AAAAAAAAs7o/aARthxb71oc/s1600/doffggwnload.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Basically the fish\nladder is a series of ascending pools that are reached not by climbing rungs,\nbut by swimming against a stream of water. The fish leap through the cascade of\nrushing water, rest in the pool and then repeat the process until they're\nbeyond the dam on the upper part of the river .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just imagine Hilsa fish used to\nswing 1300 kilometers up the Ganges when NO dams existed. This is NO bull, as\nthis fish stays in the sea and swims up the river only to spawn. Now they can\nonly swim till the Farakka Barrage. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Farraka Barrage has\nprevented the spawning of migratory fish, and siltation compounds their\nproblems, making the river bed too shallow for them to lay their eggs.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can see thousand of fishing boats\ncatching the Hilsa fish even before they could spawn\u2014 depriving the poor\nBengali off his Hilsa machchi and mouth watering Macher Jhol.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-c8x0bJhmgbQ/U6WPJ0iDhOI/AAAAAAAAs7g/panm0TpsesU/s1600/hilsa2012080xwx8160114_l.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"294\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-c8x0bJhmgbQ/U6WPJ0iDhOI/AAAAAAAAs7g/panm0TpsesU/s1600/hilsa2012080xwx8160114_l.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While fish ladders are\ndesigned to get the fish back upstream to the spawning grounds, there may not\nbe protection for the young fish going downstream.&nbsp; Without built-in protection, the young fish\ncould get caught in a turbine, for example, leading to injury or even death.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fish passing\nfree falling over a dam become stressed, injured, disoriented, or die . They get\ninjured and shocked when in contact with turbines, the walls of the dam, or\ndeflection screens.&nbsp;&nbsp; They then exit into\na relatively small area where their exposure to predators is increased.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is something\ncalled super saturation .&nbsp; It is a danger\nfor fish going over a dam or through its spillway.&nbsp; When water is spilled over a dam huge\nturbulence is created .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because air is comprised of 78% nitrogen, the level of\nnitrogen dissolved in the water increase dramatically. The affected water does\nnot lose the excess nitrogen quickly.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Supersaturated water enter tissues.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">If fish swim from an area supersaturated with nitrogen to a lower\npressure area, a condition similar to \u201cthe bends\u201d in scuba diving can occur.\nThis effect causes injury and can even cause death to fish.</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Salmon&nbsp; are the most well-known species of fish that\nmigrate up and down streams. As a species, salmon are called anadromous because\nthey migrate from fresh water to the oceans and then back again.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the case of Hilsa they migrate from the\nsea up the fresh water river to spawn.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hilsa deposits its eggs in fresh\nwater. Hilsa eggs are hatched in fresh water at about 73 degrees Fahrenheit.\nThis fish initially feeds on zooplankton, and then on phytoplankton. Large\nscale impounding of water in upstream dam reservoirs later discharging will\nlower the temperature in spawning rivers, in addition to the turbulence&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nis no more Hilsa fish in Allahabad,&nbsp; ever\nsince the&nbsp; construction of the Farakka\nBarrage in 1975.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When they hatch, the\nlarvae and juveniles migrate to sea over several months, feeding and growing en\nroute. At this early stage of their life they are known locally as\n\"Jatka,\" and range from 4-15 centimeters&nbsp; in length.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A mature Hilsa with a length\nranging from 30-55 cm lays one lakh to 20 lakh eggs. The eggs are deposited in\nfresh water, and hatching takes place in about 24 hours .The newly hatched\nlarvae is around 2.3 mm in size and the larvae and juveniles make their way\ndownstream to the sea during a period of several months, feeding and growing on\nthe way. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At this stage of their\nlife cycle they are locally known as \"Jatka\". Usually Jatka grazes\nfor five to six months age in fresh water before they migrate to seawater. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After growing for 1-2\nyears in sea, Hilsa shad matures and reaches an size of 35-55 cm prior to their\nspawning migration towards inland rivers, and the cycle continues. In 2006, the\nstate\u2019s government banned the catch of hilsa weighing less than 500 grammes.(.\nkhoka ilish. ). &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"background-color: white; color: #3f3f3f; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hilsa fishing is now completely banned on either side of the\nFarakka barrage, 5 km upstream and 5 km downstream.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6wrveAlbPL8/U6WWiT3sWnI/AAAAAAAAs8I/mV7gIqxYRpo/s1600/rajmahal_holy_DDmap.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"528\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6wrveAlbPL8/U6WWiT3sWnI/AAAAAAAAs8I/mV7gIqxYRpo/s1600/rajmahal_holy_DDmap.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hilsa fish nowadays\ntastes all fu#kin' balls . The rise of water temperature and water pollution has\ntriggered early maturity of hilsa. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why blame Hilsa?&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the\nwest girls get their periods at the age of 9, while their great grandmothers\ngot their periods at the age of 15. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hilsa would earlier\ntake at least two years to become mature, it is now reaching maturity in a year.&nbsp; Hilsa weighing a puny &nbsp;150gm was found to be bearing eggs; something\nthat should have been seen in Hilsa weighing 500gm or more. \"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HULLO DADAS AND DIDIS \u2013\nIF YOU WANT TO EAT HILSA FISH, EITHER GET RID OF THE FARAKKA BARRAGE , IN WHICH\nCASE SHIPS CANNOT COME TO CALCUTTA ANY MORE.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-YOrSzn1h0iw/U6WV_KspqsI/AAAAAAAAs8A/Db6OyIw-ZYg/s1600/hvbbverilsha8-10.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-YOrSzn1h0iw/U6WV_KspqsI/AAAAAAAAs8A/Db6OyIw-ZYg/s1600/hvbbverilsha8-10.jpg\" width=\"484\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE OTHER WAY IS TO FORCE THE GOVT\nTO BUILD A PROPER TWO WAY FISH LADDER, AS A PORIBORTAN MEASURE&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6Wtjv2SV0AQ/U6WXHh7B6qI/AAAAAAAAs8U/VIzZRTzdvDo/s1600/The-Farakka-bNHRarrage-.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"236\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6Wtjv2SV0AQ/U6WXHh7B6qI/AAAAAAAAs8U/VIzZRTzdvDo/s1600/The-Farakka-bNHRarrage-.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Down stream of a dam,\nthe river is starved of its structural materials and cannot provide\nhabitat.&nbsp; Migratory fish like salmon,\nwhich are born upstream&nbsp; may not survive\ntheir downstream trip&nbsp; through a dam.\nThey stand a poor chance of completing the round trip to spawn.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams hold back\nnot only fertile silt and sediment, but also debris. The life of organisms\n(including fish) downstream depends on the constant feeding of the river with\ndebris. This debris includes leaves, twigs, branches, and whole trees, as well\nas the organic remains of dead animals.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Debris not only provides food, it\nprovides hiding places for all sizes of animals and surfaces for phytoplankton\nand microorganisms to grow. Without flooding and without a healthy riparian\nzone, this debris will be scarce.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adding to the problem, although debris might\ncome from the river above the dam, it is instead trapped in the reservoir, and\nnever appears downstream. The bottom level of the food web is removed. All in\nall, the loss of sediment and debris means the loss of both nutrients and\nhabitat for aquatic life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams on the Ganges\nriver have decreased the flow of river water ,which means fewer habitats,\nnutrients, and increased stresses on aquatic life downstream. This has caused\nmassive changes in the ecology and water quality of the river and its tributaries.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The devastation of\nfreshwater ecosystems directly affects the livelihoods of millions of people\nwho live upstream and downstream of dams, especially in India where a lot of\npeople depend on farming and fishing.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And this is in addition to the large numbers of people that are\nrelocated to make way for the reservoirs.&nbsp;\nIf you work out the economics and logistics , dams costs outweigh their\nbenefits.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rich western countries and\nthe International banksters are very keen to lend money to India for building\nmore dams on the Ganges.&nbsp; Kickbacks to\ncorrupt politicians cause things to be less transparent , even though the bad\neffects are irreversible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Underground aquifers\nkeep water unpolluted and safe without evaporation. &nbsp;Flowing rivers feed underground aquifers\nhundreds of miles away from the banks. &nbsp;This\nhas been going on since antiquity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The damage that dams\ncause to river ecosystems is immense, turning free-flowing waterways into\nlifeless lakes, killing plants and trees, blocking fish migration and breeding,\ndriving species to extinction, and devastating established patterns of human\nlife. Many species of fresh water fish in the ganges is now extinct.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By diverting water for\npower ( which can be produced by other means ), dams remove water needed for\nhealthy in-stream ecosystems. Stretches below dams are often completely\nde-watered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Dams slow down rivers.&nbsp; Many fish species, such as salmon, depend on\nsteady flows to flush them downriver early in their life and guide them\nupstream years later to spawn. Stagnant reservoir pools disorient migrating\nfish and significantly increase the duration of their migration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams alter water\ntemperatures.&nbsp; By slowing water flow,\nmost dams increase water temperatures.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flowing rivers are\nfairly homogenous in temperature. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dam reservoirs,\non the other hand, are layered. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">They are\nwarm at the top and cold at the bottom. If water is released downstream, the\ndown stream temperature is affected . Many macroinvertebrates depend on a\nregular cycle of temperatures throughout the year. When we change that, we endanger\nthem.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fish are sensitive to these temperature irregularities, which often destroy native\npopulations.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams alter timing of\nflows. By withholding and then releasing water to generate power for peak\ndemand periods, dams cause downstream stretches to alternate between no water\nand powerful surges that erode soil and vegetation, and flood or strand\nwildlife. These irregular releases destroy natural seasonal flow variations\nthat trigger natural growth and reproduction cycles in many species.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams decrease oxygen\nlevels in reservoir waters.&nbsp; When\noxygen-deprived water is released from behind the dam, it kills fish\ndownstream.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams hold back silt,\ndebris, and nutrients.&nbsp; By slowing flows,\ndams allow silt to collect on river bottoms and bury fish spawning habitat.\nSilt trapped above dams accumulates heavy metals and other pollutants. Gravel,\nlogs and other debris are also trapped by dams, eliminating their use\ndownstream as food and habitat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams increase predator\nrisk.&nbsp; Warm, murky reservoirs often favor\npredators of naturally occurring species. In addition, passage through fish\nladders or turbines injure or stun fish, making them easy prey for flying\npredators like gulls and herons. &nbsp;You can\nsee this yourself at any dam.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The decay of Ganges\nriver began with the Haridwar dam built in 1854 by the white invader. This dam\ngreatly diminished the flow of the river.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reservoirs from large\ndams evaporate huge quantities of water. &nbsp;When a hydroelectric project results in\ninundation of a free-flowing river, the nesting, forage, and cover provided by\nthese areas is temporarily or permanently lost.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dam reservoirs trap\nnutrient-laden sediments behind the dam.&nbsp;\nThis reduces reservoir volumes and accelerates a cycle of eutrophication\n(or oxygen depletion) that results in increased plant and algal growth,\nbacterial decomposition that consumes oxygen, and release of phosphorus that\nnourishes further algal growth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic materials from\nwithin and outside the river that would normally wash downstream get built up\nbehind dams and start to consume a large amount of oxygen as they decompose.\nAlgae blooms , create oxygen-starved \u201cdead zones\u201d incapable of supporting river\nlife of any kind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can have high\nlevels of dissolved oxygen at the top from the algal growth, and ten feet below\nthat--zero.&nbsp; So only the top ten feet of\nthe reservoir is the only habitable area for river fish. There has been no\npractice to&nbsp; periodically release a\nspecific volume of water according to the level required to maintain the\ndolphins' habitat..&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Statistics have\nshown that the river dolphin population in India is at less than 2000, compared\nto more than 7000 , thrity years ago. When stream banks and riparian areas\nbecome covered by the dam reservoir\u2019s higher water level, the result is called\ninundation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Habitat conditions change and a new equilibrium emerges. As this\noccurs, a different set of dynamics begin impacting species that traditionally\ngrow, nest, feed, or spawn in these areas. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the dams on the\nGanges do NOT have the ability to remove result . &nbsp;No silt removing tunnel was built into the\ndam.&nbsp; When sediments collect, the\necosystem can be affected in two ways.&nbsp;\nThe downstream habitat conditions decline because these silt and\nsediments no longer provide important organic and inorganic nutrients. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When sediment builds up behind a dam, an\neffect called \u201cnutrient loading\u201dcan cause the supply of oxygen to be depleted.&nbsp; This happ.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ens because more nutrients are now\navailable, thus more organisms populate the dam adjacent reservoir area to\nconsume the nutrients.&nbsp; As these\norganisms consume the nutrients, more oxygen is used, depleting the supply of\noxygen in the reservoir.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>Below video: The thought of the ongoing DELIBERATE murder the river Ganges ( soul of Bharatmata ) &nbsp;launches me often into the song by Chris Rhea --THE ROAD TO HELL</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of my readers may\nthink that my sailors ( and the captain himself) , are behaving in a frivolous\nmanner .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: large;\"><b>MELTING EGO, MEDITATION\nVIA BACK DOOR VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt Ajit Vadakayil is\none of the very few leaders on this planet, who managed by HUMOR MANAGEMENT\u2014\nthe ultimate in man and seaman management.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These are things you do NOT fiind in\nbooks. This brand of man management is NOT taught in management and HR schools.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>HUMOR MANAGEMENT\nVADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin: 0in;\">\nThe toxic chemical effluents from tanneries by the banks of\nthe river Ganges, especially more than 400 tanneries at Kanpur has slowed down\nthe self cleansing capability of the river Ganges\u2014basically killing the\nbacteriophages and flocculating the magic Himalayan colloids..<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;\">\n<br />\nAll collids are electrically charged. Colloidal particles are in constant\nmotion because of bombardment by molecules of dispersion medium. This motion is\ncalled Brownian motion.Contact with certain chemicals cause them to lose their\ncharge.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;\">\n<br />\n&nbsp;The river can get rid of organic pollutants\u2014but non-biodegradable\nchemical pollutants makes the water toxic. &nbsp;Regular BOD5 and COD tests\nmust be done and recorded in a transparent website on the Internet with trends.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>&nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>BOD5</b> means</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) in water . It\nmeasures the amount of oxygen required or consumed for the microbiological\ndecomposition (oxidation) of organic material in water.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The unit of Measurement is</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">mg/l of oxygen consumed in 5 days at a\nconstant</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">temperature of 20\u00b0C in the\ndark.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Basically BOD5 is a\nuseful measure to assess the effectiveness of sewage water treatment\nprocesses.&nbsp; BOD5 is a measure of the\namount of oxygen that is consumed by bacteria as it breaks down organic matter\nin a sample during a five-day period under standardized conditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BOD5 limit could range\nfrom 5\u201350 mg/liter, depending upon your wastewater flow, receiving stream flow\nand the water quality standards of the receiving waters .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Legend has it that the\n5-day BOD (Biological or Biochemical Oxygen Demand) test was developed in\nEngland.&nbsp; Sewage was dumped in a river\nand it took five days for gora shit to travel from London to the North sea. --\nhence the five-day incubation requirement in the BOD method. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The BOD5 of sewage\nvaries from several hundred to about 1000 mg/l for raw sewage, and from about\n10 to 20 mg/l for good quality secondary effluent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BOD can be used as a\ngauge of the effectiveness of wastewater treatment plants.&nbsp; BOD is similar in function to chemical oxygen\ndemand (COD), in that both measure the amount of organic compounds in water.\nHowever, COD is less specific, since it measures everything that can be\nchemically oxidized, rather than just levels of biologically active organic\nmatter. Fish and aquatic insects may die when oxygen is depleted by microbial\nmetabolism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">COD</b> is a measure of the\namount of oxygen required to breakdown the organic matter in a sample under\nvery strong oxidizing conditions. During the COD test, the sample is subjected\nto boiling with sulfuric acid and a strong oxidizer, such as potassium\ndichromate.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">COD or Chemical Oxygen\nDemand is the total measurement of all chemicals in the water that can be\noxidized.&nbsp; COD is usually a measurement\nof chemicals and the test is simple and easy to perform with the right\nequipment and can be done in 2 hours.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;A COD test measures all organic carbon with\nthe exception of certain aromatics (benzene, toluene, phenol, etc.) which are\nnot completely oxidized in the reaction. COD is a chemically chelated/thermal\noxidation reaction, and therefore, other reduced substances such as sulfides,\nsulfites, and ferrous iron will also be oxidized and reported as COD.&nbsp;&nbsp; NH3-N (ammonia) will NOT be oxidized as COD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most applications of\nCOD determine the amount of organic pollutants found in surface water (e.g.\nlakes and rivers) or wastewater, making COD a useful measure of water quality.\nIt is expressed in milligrams per liter (mg/L) also referred to as ppm (parts\nper million), which indicates the mass of oxygen consumed per liter of solution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jawaharlal Nehru, despite\nmaking the Tehri Dam had great respect for Ganga. &nbsp;His grandson Rajiv Gandhi neglected the river.\n&nbsp;&nbsp;The\nItalian Catholic woman killed the river in just 10 years of her rule. 1 billion\nHindus kept protesting.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the queen bee did NOT care too much. Evangelists\neager on soul harvesting went on overdrive.
