, serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Garbage land fills must\nbe situated far away from the river banks and definitely NOT on top of large\naquifers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Landfills MUST have a\nprotective bottom layer of impermeable clay , covered with tough and resilient\nplastic sheets, to prevent contaminants from getting into the ground\nwater.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If there is no proper bottom\nlayer or it is cracked,&nbsp; contaminants\nfrom the landfill ( used engine lub oil, car battery acid, paint, household\ncleaners, chemicals etc.) can make their way down into the groundwater.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Polluted ground water is less visible, but more difficult to clean up, than\npollution in rivers and lakes. Ground water pollution most often results from\nimproper disposal of wastes on land..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Time for me to bust the\nIndian dam bubble.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India has been\narmtwisted to build hydroelectric projects ( funded by R ) stating that this\nenergy is clean and helps combat global warming.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oh yeah?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What about the methane\nproduced by submerged forests ?<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But the adverse effects\nof river impoundments--disruption of ecosystems, decline of fish stocks, forced\nresettlements, and disease--have of late made dams symbols of corporate and\ngovernmental hubris.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most dam building is\ndriven by greed\u2014this is a very potent statement.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So many dams have been\nbuilt in Uttaranchal where the ground is unstable. The great continental drift\nis still raising the height of Mount Everest.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bad dams are the\nshallow ones that flood large areas of land, without under ground aquifers to\nsoak the water seeping under the ground , which lose water by evaporation , or\nthat produce relatively little power. The worst hydropower projects may produce\nmore [greenhouse gases] than a coal-fired equivalent.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A flowing river is very\ndifferent from a stagnant dam reservoir with silt at the bottom , which is home\neven to malaria and. Schistosomiasis. Incidence of schistosomiasis, the\nlong-term consequences of which can include pulmonary lesions, liver failure,\nand bladder cancer, has been rising very fast..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">USA suffered from\nexcessive dam building\u2014now they are breaking up their dams in a phased manner.\nEnvironmental laws and public pressure have forced utilities and bureaucracies\nto restore some of the natural flow of riverine ecosystems.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike the West who\nis still surviving on stolen money, diving and recreational fishing are\nscarcely concerns for the majority of people in poor developing countries.\nThese people need clean, potable water.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Cities can get enough water if they\ndo rainwater harvesting and recharge underground aquifers. The moment the river\nflows with a good quantity of water, the ground water level comes up like magic\n.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the dams in\nIndia do NOT have proper silt removal facility from the bottom of the dam\nreservoirs. Silt reduces dam capacity, thereby diminishing generating power, or\ndeplete downstream farmlands, which are dependent upon silt for nutrients.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Absence of silt which\ncoats the humous soil in every flood , makes the nation totally dependant on\nartificial fertlisers, which keeps the soil perpetually thirsty.&nbsp; Of course the GM companies will say that they\nwill give you sterile terminator seeds which require very less water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many wild animals\nliving along the Ganges totally owe their existence to the river. If the Ganges\nremains polluted, the wildlife will not survive in the coming generations. The\nentire length of Ganges river is increasingly choked by dams, drained by\nirrigation canals, and fouled by industrial, agricultural, and human waste. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">HUNDREDS MORE DAMS ARE\nIN STAGES OF PLANNING \u2014BY MAD MEN AND CORRUPT DESH DROHIS .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Despite the Uttaranchal\ndisaster , MAD MEN are still planning projects&nbsp;\ninvolving drilling huge tunnels in the hills by blasting rocks, placing\nenormous turbines in the tunnels, cutting down forests to build water channels,\nroads, townships and other infrastructure, and laying transmission lines by\nother destructive methods.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many dams are\nbuilt on the same river so close to one another that they leave zilch scope for\nthe river's regeneration. These dams alter the hydrological cycle and change\nthe natural course of rivers.&nbsp; Diverting\nrivers at the source&nbsp; through tunnels cut\nthrough the mountain, leaving long stretches of rivers dry and without allowing\nthe rivers time and space to regenerate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why has the UPA govt\nnot been transparent with the damages to various dams in the last floods?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The floodwaters of\nUttaracnhal were , laden with&nbsp; thousands\nof tonnes of silt, boulders and debris from dam construction, found no outlet.\nThe routes they took for thousands of years in the past, including ravines and\nstreams, were blocked with sand and rocks.&nbsp;\nThe waters inundated scores of towns and villages, submerging countless\nbuildings under several feet of mud,&nbsp;\nsmothering life.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Why is is Uttarkhand\nexperiencing such enormous scale of landslides ? Ever heard of deforestation?\nWho the hell cares for providing water sport activities for the white invader\ntourists who robbed us blind ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We Indians do NOT want\nany more dams in Uttaranchal\u2014rather some useless dams have to be pulled down..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The engineers who designed the Uttaranchal dams have NO idea of the enormous\namount&nbsp; of mud, silt, and grit which can\nbe carried by Himalayan rivers. The load of ragged-edged grains of quartz and\nfeldspar constantly overwhelm settling basins, and chew up pipes and turbines.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZakxMR3TRyM/U6mB_WAf6wI/AAAAAAAAtBY/wyBEl8WGQIY/s1600/vvff.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"610\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZakxMR3TRyM/U6mB_WAf6wI/AAAAAAAAtBY/wyBEl8WGQIY/s1600/vvff.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Has anybody ever conducted a study of the enormous amount of money , that has\nbeen wasted on Uttaranchal dams ?&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-k_a_hPUG6rA/U6mDbbTh85I/AAAAAAAAtCE/MjiSh2MyJO0/s1600/flood_monsoon_ukhajytdrnd_pti5.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-k_a_hPUG6rA/U6mDbbTh85I/AAAAAAAAtCE/MjiSh2MyJO0/s1600/flood_monsoon_ukhajytdrnd_pti5.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The June 2013 disaster was just a small\nexample of how nature will strike back if we disregard the ecological limits of\nfragile regions like the Himalayas through reckless and mindless dam building.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OUYForwtDfE/U6sFpCkJ3QI/AAAAAAAAtKQ/ECdf-bvCzb0/s1600/Shivnvf-300x275.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"366\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-OUYForwtDfE/U6sFpCkJ3QI/AAAAAAAAtKQ/ECdf-bvCzb0/s1600/Shivnvf-300x275.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 400-megawatt Vishnuprayag Hydroelectric Project, upriver from Srinagar\nalong the Alaknanda River, was buried beneath 20 meters of rubble that also\nfilled its water storage lake..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 76-megawatt\nPhata-Byung Hydroelectric Project under construction on the Mandakini\nRiver,&nbsp; was washed away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 99-megawatt\nSingoli-Bhatwari Hydroelectric Project downstream on the Mandakini, a major\ntributary of the Alaknanda, was pounded and damaged by huge boulders <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 330-megawatt\nAlaknanda Hydro Power Project in Srinagar was about to be commissioned. But the\npowerhouse and turbines were inundated with mud and silt .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ic_UBVDuTpU/U6m6rrUkf0I/AAAAAAAAtEU/Ro_LNOlbrsM/s1600/121f069d-0e69ktf-48fe-a30e-d82436c47ee3Wallpaper1.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Ic_UBVDuTpU/U6m6rrUkf0I/AAAAAAAAtEU/Ro_LNOlbrsM/s1600/121f069d-0e69ktf-48fe-a30e-d82436c47ee3Wallpaper1.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the 280 mega watt\nDhauliganga project near the border with Nepal the entire turbine room\nconstructed deep inside the hill near the dam was submerged , causing at least\n$50 million in damage .&nbsp; A landslide\nblocked the end of the water discharge tunnel<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The 520-megawatt\nTapovan-Vishnugad dam, under construction on an Alaknanda River tributary and\nseriously damaged last year by a flash flood, was hit again. The tunnel\ncarrying water to the powerhouse, finished in April 2013, was washed away in\nJune.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just upriver, the\n171-megawatt Lata Tapovan project, under construction and approaching its 2017\nopening, was overrun by flood waters that damaged concrete work and forced at\nleast a year-long delay in its commissioning. The delay could grow longer\nbecause the highway network is so broken and unstable it is unsafe to transport\nheavy equipment that is needed for repairs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both of the Maneri\nBhali projects on the Bhagirathi River were damaged. The 25-year-old Maneri I\ndam, with a 99-megwatt generating capacity, and the 304-megawatt dam that\nopened in 2008, were hit hard enough for walls to collapse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An enormous amount of\nrock, silt and mud and boulders ( mostly discarded after mindless dam building\n) were washed off during the June 2013 flood , that they filled the riverbeds.\nThe rivers of the Alaknanda and Bhaghirati basin have become shallow.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pFDD4cOldbc/U6mDB3Jop5I/AAAAAAAAtBs/H3f4Qy-owgk/s1600/Pic-3-Colossavferl-Apathy1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"372\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pFDD4cOldbc/U6mDB3Jop5I/AAAAAAAAtBs/H3f4Qy-owgk/s1600/Pic-3-Colossavferl-Apathy1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NO BODY IS WILLING TO\nADMIT THAT DAM OPERATORS IN UTTARANCHAL OPENED SLUICE GATES IN AN EMERGENCY\nWITHOUT PRE-WARNING AND CAUSED ALL THE DAMAGE AND LOSS OF LIFE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This\nuseless rubble has now occupied the place of the original river bottom which\nexisted for thousand of years. . More floods disasters are awaiting . Why is\nnobody being held accountable?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">The 600 MW Loharinag\nPala Hydro Power Project is An example of a MAD project on the river\nBhagirathi, the head streamof the Ganges River ,100&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">kilometers</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;upstream of the Tehri Dam.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9OphLboaUIk/U6mBeMvmbEI/AAAAAAAAtBQ/gN1IAt4XLkA/s1600/200903132605+v04104.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tehri itself has\nkilled the river.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-zs4dvd_ty3k/U6mCfZUaOiI/AAAAAAAAtBk/qkmm1STPLSY/s1600/FL12_LOHbtrARINAG_1495234g.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Who is the MAD MAN who planned this MW Loharinag Pala project\nby diverting the river into a manmade tunnel inside the mountain ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: The blades of the turbine are expected to withstand the scouring of the sharp stone and sand laden water torrent .&nbsp;</span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EYFoofZl4HE/U6mBXVEt8cI/AAAAAAAAtBI/V3ZBX5F5ayc/s1600/Tunnelingxxx-in-the-Mountain.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"424\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-EYFoofZl4HE/U6mBXVEt8cI/AAAAAAAAtBI/V3ZBX5F5ayc/s1600/Tunnelingxxx-in-the-Mountain.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Apart from rapidly\nfilling their reservoirs, sediment\u2013filled rivers cause &nbsp;abrasion of turbines and other dam components.\nThe efficiency of a turbine is largely dependent upon the hydraulic properties\nof its blades, just as an aeroplane depends on the aerodynamic properties of\nits wings. The erosion and cracking of the tips of turbine blades by\nwater\u2013borne sand and silt considerably reduces their generating efficiency and\ncan require expensive repairs.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tehri dam, Nehru\u2019s pet\nproject , probably the biggest environmental disaster in the world, &nbsp;is 170 Km down stream from the Ganga\u2019s\nGlacier. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LqPJUAQ04ug/U6mGJuRZaMI/AAAAAAAAtCQ/a5ZHHOoNP7U/s1600/power+projects+in+ubrtarakhand.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"386\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-LqPJUAQ04ug/U6mGJuRZaMI/AAAAAAAAtCQ/a5ZHHOoNP7U/s1600/power+projects+in+ubrtarakhand.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The construction of\nfour dams \u2014 Pala Maneri, Maneri-Bahli, Lohari Nagpala and Bhairon Ghate \u2014 had\nled to the drying up of the Bhagirathi. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The planned building of\nhundreds of dams on the Ganges in this modern age whem power can be obtained by\nnuclear plants is a deep rooted conspiracy to destroy river Ganga and all Hindu pilgrim centres on it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And don\u2019t get carried\naway by the false propaganda about burning coal warming up this planet. The\noverfed western cows fart more methane and warm the planet more.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">THE LIE OF GREENHOUSE\nGASES CAUSING GLOBAL WARMING&nbsp; VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The whole Bhagirathi\nvalley is ruined by the mad men cutting forest and digging tunnels through\nmountains .....and now the govt wants to save the glacier by limiting the\nnumber of tourist to 150 per day to the glacier.</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><i>&nbsp;USA quietly removed removed 51 dams in 2013. <o:p></o:p></i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><i><br /></i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><i>Outdated or unsafe dams\ncame out of rivers in Alabama, California, Colorado, Idaho, Illinois, Maine,\nMassachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon,\nPennsylvania, South Dakota, Vermont, Virginia, Wisconsin and Wyoming, restoring\nmore than 500 miles of streams for the benefit of fish, wildlife and people. <o:p></o:p></i></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><i><br /></i></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><i>1,150 dams that have\nbeen removed across the country since 1912-out of which more than&nbsp; 850 dams were removed in the past 20 years.</i></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bfrXnbveJ2c/U6mZw18ckJI/AAAAAAAAtCo/2LuilSRRi-Y/s1600/dam-reeecmoval.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bfrXnbveJ2c/U6mZw18ckJI/AAAAAAAAtCo/2LuilSRRi-Y/s1600/dam-reeecmoval.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are several useless\ndams on the Ganges which were built by corrupt people solely to obtain\nkickbacks in foreign bank accounts . &nbsp;These\ndams must be identified ( very little power/ no irrigation value / does NOT\nprevent floods rather aggravates floods) and taken down. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Contrary to popular belief , rivers are NOT\nmeant to stay within their banks - they must overflow their banks annually and deposit\nsuper fertile silt . &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>If &nbsp;peoples houses get invaded by water, HULLO--\u2014 fu#k\noff from there\u2014 you have built your houses in the wrong place.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams block sediment\nflow\u2014 unless they have desilting tunnels or bottom gates.&nbsp;&nbsp;None of\nour dams on the Ganges has ever considered the silt buildup .&nbsp;&nbsp;Without\nsilt by passing the river bottom becomes more rocky, as sediment no longer\nfills gaps between larger stones.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dam reservoirs, also\ncalled lakes, are created when storage projects are built.\nReservoirs&nbsp;&nbsp;reduce&nbsp;the water volume down stream of the dam .\nSurface temperatures tend to become warmer as the slower moving or \u201cslack\u201d\nwater absorbs heat from the sun.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">An un-dammed river is\ndynamic, ever changing and comprised of many different ecological niches.\nEcosystems and cultures are dependent on this god given dynamism.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dam reservoirs submerge\nforests . There is constant release of greenhouse gas methane from rotting\nvegetation. Decaying organic matter</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">cause eutrophic conditions in the reservoir, leading to algae blooms,\nfurther oxygen depletion, and massive fish kills.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When this happens, the water from dam\nreservoirs and directly downstream is often unfit for human and animal\nconsumption for years after the project is completed. No moving well oxygenated\nriver can have algae growth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">At an unstable area\nwhere two tectonic plates collide , reservoirs increase the risk of earthquakes\nby adding immense pressure to the earth from the large volumes and weight of\nthe stored water. Rainforest soils are often extremely delicate; their thin\nlayer of topsoil highly vulnerable to erosion.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eroded soils are washed into the\ndam reservoirs, causing a build-up of siltation that eventually leads to loss\nof the reservoirs' storage capacity over time. The soil deposits that are\ntrapped behind the dam's barriers deprive the riverbanks downstream of seasonal\nnutrient replenishment. Loss of the source of silt and soil from upstream also\ncauses serious erosion of the riverbank land.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The especially fertile delta\nareas stop growing, start disappearing, and loose their source of fertility.\nFarmers are now forced to use artificial fertilizers and fall prey to the\nclutches of immoral GM food companies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reduced water flow in the delta area\nwill cause salt water to intrude up the river and into underground aquifers ,\nwhich will damage crops, soil and ground water supplies . The</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">extensive mangrove forests at the Ganges\ndelta are fast disappearing.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Accumulation of water which evaporates in large dam reservoirs have\naffect the age old established seasonal climate\u2014 this is being touted as global\nwarming effects to stop India from using her abundant coal reserves...</b></span></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India needs to practice\nENERGY CONSERVATION. This must be a compulsory subject in schools and colleges.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wanna have a general\nidea what this is ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>ENERGY CONSERVATION ON\nCHEMICAL TANKERS&nbsp; VADAKAYIL</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dams are super\nexpensive and the projected financial costs are ALWAYS inaccurate. The benefits\nare often overestimated, driven by the incentives / kickbacks given by\nInternational Money Lenders to</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">politicians and expert consultants . Just a few years ago to oppose the\nconstruction of the dams was social heresy \u2013thank god for the Internet .</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hardly any dams on the\nganges hold any good amount of water due to sediment buildup at the reservoir.\nA huge quantity of this water just evaporates.&nbsp;\nThese dams do NOT have silt removal facility. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qZYG2AIkuB8/U6mrbpCqbdI/AAAAAAAAtDQ/LuqwaVLI2KE/s1600/article-2170185-13F64D8B000005DC-298_964x603.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-qZYG2AIkuB8/U6mrbpCqbdI/AAAAAAAAtDQ/LuqwaVLI2KE/s1600/article-2170185-13F64D8B000005DC-298_964x603.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wanna see a China dam with silt removing\nfacility ? &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-B2BeM3rKl3I/U6mrr5OnjZI/AAAAAAAAtDY/2jpVC2SCbVA/s1600/article-0-13F3F97C000005DC-820_964x635.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"420\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-B2BeM3rKl3I/U6mrr5OnjZI/AAAAAAAAtDY/2jpVC2SCbVA/s1600/article-0-13F3F97C000005DC-820_964x635.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the THREE GORGES DAM over\nthe Yangtse , which is so huge that it can be seen from space.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-NtPFbRVYSQI/U6mr6pS8TYI/AAAAAAAAtDg/tqVJb9vQ1W0/s1600/article-0-13F67C3E000005DC-747_964x635.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"420\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-NtPFbRVYSQI/U6mr6pS8TYI/AAAAAAAAtDg/tqVJb9vQ1W0/s1600/article-0-13F67C3E000005DC-747_964x635.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a dam collapses ,\nthere is a domino effect . The rush of water could overwhelm the next dam\ndownstream, causing dams to collapse like dominos.&nbsp; In 1975 the 118-meter Banqiao dam on a\ntributary of the Huai China was breached in a heavy rainstorm.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Numerous dams\ndownstream gave way in succession to produce a lake of more than 7,300 square\nkilometers. Six counties were inundated. By a conservative estimate, 26,000\ndied in the flooding and another 145,000 in the ensuing epidemics and famine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nor do big dams protect\nfrom floods and droughts. They store water during the wet season and release it\nduring the dry season. Deprived of their annual inundations, downstream\nmarshes, lakes, and wetlands dry out and can no longer absorb floodwaters. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the\nrecord-breaking summer flood of 2010, the Three Gorges reservoir rose to 12\nmeters above \"alarm level.\" To protect the dam, its operators opened\nthe floodgates to the maximum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Downstream some 968\npeople were killed, 507 more were missing and economic losses totaled $26\nbillion. The great dam survived its first test, but its floodplain is unlikely\nto contain big floods in the future.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nor do big dams protect\nfrom floods and droughts. They store water during the wet season and release it\nduring the dry season. Deprived of their annual inundations, downstream\nmarshes, lakes, and wetlands dry out and can no longer absorb floodwaters. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the\nrecord-breaking summer flood of 2010, the Three Gorges reservoir rose to 12\nmeters above \"alarm level.\" To protect the dam, its operators opened\nthe floodgates to the maximum.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Downstream some 968\npeople were killed, 507 more were missing and economic losses totaled $26\nbillion. The great dam survived its first test, but its floodplain is unlikely\nto contain big floods in the future.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>The Ganges is in\nserious danger from 600 dams that are either operational, under construction or\nproposed. We Indians do NOT want this type of development.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a HUGE dam is\nbuilt and the reservoir filled with water, the amount of pressure exerted on\nthe earth in that area changes dramatically.&nbsp;\nWhen the water level of a reservoir is raised, pressure on the\nunderlying ground increases; when the water level is lowered, the pressure\ndecreases.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This fluctuation can stress\nthe delicate balance between tectonic plates beneath the surface, possibly\ncausing them to shift. And we all know that Tehri dam is on unstable ground. If\nTehri dam bursts the downstream populations in the holy cities of Devaprayag,\nRishikesh and Haridwar (important sites of Indian learning and pilgrimage)\nwould be wiped off the face of the earth. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Even in the eighteenth century the ships of\nthe East India Company would come all the way to Allahabad. Now only smaller\nocean traffic can make it through the Hooghly to Calcutta , beyond which the\nsilting prevents all deep-draft vessels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ganga is mentioned in\nthe 700 year old Rigveda, the earliest and theoretically the holiest of the\nHindu scriptures. Ganga is mentioned in the nadistuti (Rigveda 10.75), which\nlists the rivers from east to west. In RV 6.45.31, the word Ganga is also mentioned.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;During the early Vedic Age , the Sarasvati\nRiver was the major sacred river, not the Ganges. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">MOTHER OF ALL\nCIVILIZATIONS, SARASWATI 9000 BC&nbsp;\nVADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The holy Ganga river in\nIndia has its origins as the Bagirathi river at Gangotri. &nbsp;The four greatest of the tributaries are\nBagirathi, Mandakini, Alakananda and Yamuna. The origins of these are sacred\nplaces of pilgrimages for the Hindu people and are called respectively\nGangotri, Kedarnath, Badrinath and Yamnotri. To undertake these pilgrimages is\nto undertake the Char Dham. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ganges begins at\nthe confluence of the Bhagirathi and Alaknanda rivers at Devprayag. The\nBhagirathi is considered to be the truesource in Hindu culture and mythology,\nalthough the Alaknanda is longer.&nbsp; The\nheadwaters of the Alakananda are formed by snowmelt from such peaks as Nanda\nDevi, Trisul, and Kamet. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bhagirathi rises at\nthe foot of Gangotri Glacier, at Gaumukh, at an elevation of 3,892 m .&nbsp; Although many small streams comprise the headwaters\nof the Ganges, the six longest and their five confluences are considered\nsacred. The six headstreams are the Alaknanda, Dhauliganga, Nandakini, Pindar,\nMandakini, and Bhagirathi rivers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The five confluences,\nknown as the Panch Prayag, are all along the Alaknanda. They are, in downstream\norder: Vishnuprayag, where the Dhauliganga joins the Alaknanda; Nandprayag,\nwhere the Nandakini joins; Karnaprayag, where the Pindar joins; Rudraprayag,\nwhere the Mandakini joins; and, finally, Devprayag, where the Bhagirathi joins\nthe Alaknanda to form the Ganges River proper. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After flowing 250\nkilometres through its narrow Himalayan valley, the Ganges emerges from the\nmountains at Rishikesh, then debouches onto the Gangetic Plain at the\npilgrimage town of Haridwar. &nbsp;At\nHaridwar, a dam diverts some of its waters into the Ganges Canal, which\nirrigates the Doabregion of Uttar Pradesh, whereas the river, whose course has\nbeen roughly southwest until this point, now begins to flow southeast through\nthe plains of northern India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ganges follows an\n800-kilometre &nbsp;arching course passing\nthrough the cities of Kannauj, Farukhabad, and Kanpur. Along the way it is\njoined by the Ramganga. The Ganges joins the Yamuna at the Triveni Sangamat\nAllahabad, a holy confluence in Hinduism. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now flowing east, the\nriver meets the Tamsa River (also called Tons), which flows north from the\nKaimur Range. &nbsp;After the Tamsa the Gomti\nRiver joins, flowing south from the Himalayas. . Then the Ghaghara\nRiver(Karnali River), also flowing south from the Himalayas of Nepal, joins.\nThe Ghaghara(Karnali), &nbsp;is the largest\ntributary of the Ganges. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the\nGhaghara(Karnali) confluence the Ganges is joined from the south by the Son\nRiver.. The Gandaki River, then the Kosi River, join from the north flowing from\nNepal. The Kosi is the third largest tributary of the Ganges, after the\nGhaghara(Karnali) and Yamuna.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Along the way between\nAllahabad and Malda, West Bengal, the Ganges passes the towns of Chunar,\nMirzapur, Varanasi, Ghazipur, Patna, Bhagalpur,Ballia, Buxar, Simaria,\nSultanganj, and Saidpur. &nbsp;At Bhagalpur,\nthe river begins to flow south-southeast and at Pakur, it begins its attrition\nwith the branching away of its first distributary, the Bh\u0101girathi-Hooghly,\nwhich goes on to become the Hooghly River. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just before the border\nwith Bangladesh the Farakka Barrage controls the flow of the Ganges, diverting\nsome of the water into a feeder canal linked to the Hooghly for the purpose of\nkeeping it relatively silt-free and navigable . The Hooghly River is formed by\nthe confluence of the Bhagirathi River and Jalangi River at Nabadwip, and\nHooghly has a number of tributaries of its own. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The largest is the\nDamodar River, which is 541 km &nbsp;long. The\nHooghly River empties into the Bay of Bengal near Sagar Island. &nbsp;Between Malda and the Bay of Bengal, the\nHooghly river passes the towns and cities of Murshidabad, Nabadwip, Kolkata and\nHowrah.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Y0ynH9y8s2k/U6m5jvSSjWI/AAAAAAAAtEI/fXWkDTd9waw/s1600/gbm-degreyta.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Y0ynH9y8s2k/U6m5jvSSjWI/AAAAAAAAtEI/fXWkDTd9waw/s1600/gbm-degreyta.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">According to a bullsh#t U.N.\nclimate report ( supported by R stooge Rajendra Pachauri ) , the Himalayan\nglaciers that are the sources of the Ganges could disappear by 2030 as\ntemperatures rise. &nbsp;If that is the case then in the same year the sun will rise\nin the West and crows will fly&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">upside</span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;down .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-pJqsAmwN2lI/U6m92sw-jbI/AAAAAAAAtEg/fTT-PYuNRCU/s1600/gangotri-glacggier-gaumukh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-pJqsAmwN2lI/U6m92sw-jbI/AAAAAAAAtEg/fTT-PYuNRCU/s1600/gangotri-glacggier-gaumukh.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ganga originates from\nthe Gangotri glacier at Gaumukh in the Indian Himalayas at 4,100 meters above\nsea level. It comes out of a hole in the ground.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o06oaRmNzME/U6m9-vt01zI/AAAAAAAAtEo/OS2JMsBVpOg/s1600/images+fe(6).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"239\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-o06oaRmNzME/U6m9-vt01zI/AAAAAAAAtEo/OS2JMsBVpOg/s1600/images+fe(6).jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In February 2014,\nBhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC), in Mumbai, India, presented their latest\ndesign for a \"next-generation nuclear reactor\" that will burn thorium\nas its fuel ore. Once built, with a target date of 2016, the reactor could\nfunction without an operator for 120 days. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India's government is also developing up to\n62, mostly thorium reactors, which it expects to be operational by 2025. &nbsp;The Modi govt must make every effort to\nprepone this date.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Right now India &nbsp;gets under 3% of its electricity from nuclear\npower, relying for the rest on coal and oil imports. We must aim for 70%\nelectricity from nuclear power and the rest from wind power and solar power. &nbsp;&nbsp;Enough funds must be sanctioned. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Foreign funded Trojan Horse NGO protestors must\nbe thrown in jail.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It expects to produce around 25% of its\nelectricity from nuclear power.&nbsp; We have\nhuge reserves of thorium. &nbsp;India\u2019s first\ncommercial fast breeder reactor \u2014 the 500 MWe Prototype Fast Breeder Reactor\n(PFBR) \u2014 is approaching completion at the Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic\nResearch, Kalpakkam, Tamil Nadu.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As of\nJuly 2013 the major equipment of the PFBR had been erected and the loading of\n\"dummy\" fuels in peripheral locations was in progress. The reactor\nwas expected to go critical by September 2014.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">India's largest nuclear\nplant at Kudankulam reached its full power recently with 1000 MW of power. The\nsecond 1000 MW units of the Kudankulam complex will become operational in 2015.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The mother of all scams\nin India, the thorium scam is kept under wraps by the foreign funded Indian\nmedia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Punch into Google\nsearch-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-O3JDrtAvtOs/U6uSsfQw4KI/AAAAAAAAtLQ/g6y_6In7XFM/s1600/world-bank-to-india-heres-1cccde-billion-clean-up-the-ganges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once regarded as amrit\n(nectar), a river that sustained all forms of life, the Ganga is now threatened\nby the very civilisation it once nurtured.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>It is NOT difficult to see the reason why the Kanpur tanneries pollute\nthe river, merrily, without a conscience.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Dams which has slowed the mighty river to stagnant pools are being built\nby corrupt politicians in order to get kickbacks in their foreign accounts.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dammed, diverted , overtapped and rubbished - the most revered of Indian rivers\nis now under grave threat along with the ancient Hindu pilgrimage centres on\nits banks..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The water of Ganga has\nsome magic qualities in the form of colloids and nano particles sediments that\ncome down from the Himalayan mountains. In the still waters of dam reservoirs,\nthese colloidal qualities are lost. </b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
