, serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Bacteriophages\nare destroyed when the open oxygenated river is diverted into dark tunnels inside\nmountains holding turbines.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Toxic chemical effluents from tanneries and\nartificial fertilser/ pesticide run offs which agglomerate nano colloids have reduced the self cleaning\nproperties of the holy Ganga.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concentrated solar energy heats water into steam which turns a steam\nturbine, which generates electricity.</span> &nbsp;In the solar collector, parabolic mirrors that\nfocus the sun's energy onto&nbsp;tube in the foreground through which a fluid\nflows.&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dNF9bZNzEiQ/U6o46hss6jI/AAAAAAAAtFE/JZurHye5B_w/s1600/solar_tffower.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-dNF9bZNzEiQ/U6o46hss6jI/AAAAAAAAtFE/JZurHye5B_w/s1600/solar_tffower.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\nThe fluid is heated, and in turn heats water to again produce steam,\nwhich as above turns a steam generator and generates electricity.<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-X3O_2749_gw/U6o5AsPI6hI/AAAAAAAAtFM/NF262pWbtAg/s1600/220px-Parabolic_trougcde.svg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In areas of India where\ngood sunshine is available, the Indian Govt must NOT issue licenses unless a\nsolar panel is fitted on the roof .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-y3ac2IKGRCs/U6o5hJMAXgI/AAAAAAAAtFk/zA261EQ3a9w/s1600/how-wind-turbiffne-works.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"380\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-y3ac2IKGRCs/U6o5hJMAXgI/AAAAAAAAtFk/zA261EQ3a9w/s1600/how-wind-turbiffne-works.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Triveni Sangam at\naneicnt Prayag ( Allahabad ) is a holy places in India where two actual rivers\nGanga and Yamuna and a third \u201cmythical\u201d or \u201cunder-terrestrial\u201d river Sarswati\nmeet.&nbsp; The 7000 year old Rig veda talks\nonly about Saraswati river.&nbsp; River Ganga\nis just mentioned once.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ysXNVFOaEK0/U6pCHCg9lYI/AAAAAAAAtF0/vb9FiAonbQo/s1600/imahhyes+(18).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"336\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ysXNVFOaEK0/U6pCHCg9lYI/AAAAAAAAtF0/vb9FiAonbQo/s1600/imahhyes+(18).jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Saraswati river was thought to be a myth till we\nlocated the lost river with our own satellites by underground mapping.\nBorewells have been dug along the length of hidden and extinct Saraswati river,\nto obtain sweet water, and extract riverbed shell molluscs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OlUoSDx-KpE/U6pCNaBQSkI/AAAAAAAAtF8/EafOitGo68s/s1600/1056g.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"381\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OlUoSDx-KpE/U6pCNaBQSkI/AAAAAAAAtF8/EafOitGo68s/s1600/1056g.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Lord Krishna\u2019s brother Balaram gives a\ndescription of his sojourn along the dying Saraswati river from Dwaraka to\nMathura in 4000 BC, when a tectonic shift at the mouth in the Himalayas made\nthe river non-perennial over the ground. Gradually the whole river was buried\nunder the Thar desert sand dunes, leaving only disconnected pools and lakes\nhere and there.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Lset1Zm6azU/U6pCXcxBg4I/AAAAAAAAtGE/7CDmk_1RTUo/s1600/imageshjr+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"265\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Lset1Zm6azU/U6pCXcxBg4I/AAAAAAAAtGE/7CDmk_1RTUo/s1600/imageshjr+(1).jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vatican was eager to\nprove that the big bang of cosmos happened in 23rd Oct 4004 BC, 9 AM ( while it\nhappened 14 billion years ago ) and that the great flood with Noah\u2019s arc and\nparty happened in 2500 BC ( life came on earth 4 billion years ago ) .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By 5000 BC, the Indian Rig Veda was written\nin Sanskrit. Every religion and prayer on this planet is an offshoot of\nHinduism and every language is an offshoot of Sanskrit. When the Saraswati\nriver started drying up, the whole elite civilization migrated to fertile lands\n\u2013 some to Ganges, some to south west of India from Goa to Kerala.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some went\nupto Mesopotamia and Sumeria.&nbsp;&nbsp; Druhyus (\nDruids as Harry Potter fans know ) who preferred colder climates went to Europe\nand Russia taking along the Indian holy swastika ( Nazi ) symbol with them.\nThis symbol was seen on pottery at the Russian equivalent of Stonehenge at\nArkaim Chelyabinsk. This grand Stonehenge is estimated by Russians at 3000\nyears older than the British Stonehenge.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0rRC01D_sD0/U6pD76Lf2KI/AAAAAAAAtGQ/Cdu-WKkea80/s1600/1jj6sld3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Kumbh Mela is held\nat the Triveni Sangam in Prayag (Allahabad) is where the three rivers, Jamuna,\nGanga and Saraswati meet every 12 years-- a month long holy festival attended\nby several million devotees.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hdKspNH351Q/U6pEqaaXMsI/AAAAAAAAtGg/SldqTORv-r8/s1600/An-Indian-Hindu-manj554-jumps-015.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"428\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hdKspNH351Q/U6pEqaaXMsI/AAAAAAAAtGg/SldqTORv-r8/s1600/An-Indian-Hindu-manj554-jumps-015.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ganga is worshipped by\nHindus who firmly believe that bathing in the river causes the remission of\nsins and facilitates Moksha (liberation from the cycle of life and death).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pilgrims travel long distances to immerse the\nashes of their kin in the waters of the Ganges, bringing their spirits closer\nto moksha.&nbsp; Several places sacred to\nHindus lie along the banks of the Ganges including Gangotri, Haridwar,\nAllahabad and Varanasi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>MOKSHA , THE FINAL STOP\nTO ENDLESS CYCLE OF EARTHLY SOJOURNS VADAKAYIL</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India , a SUPER\nHUMAN&nbsp; effort is called Bhagirata\nPratnam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per Hindu scriptures\nthe river Ganga in our legends is said to have been brought down to the Earth\nby a very ancient king by name Bhagiratha.&nbsp;\nThe river Ganga as it flows through the Himalayan ranges is also called\nBhagirathi.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ganga is said to come\nfrom the heavens onto Lord Shiva\u2019s head and from there on follow\nBhagiratha.&nbsp; Allegorically Shiva\u2019s matted\nhairlocks are a celestial dam.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matted hairlocks of\nLord Shiva represents the wind \u2013and NOT unwashed dirty hair of a corpse eating\naghoris as the vulgar white historian has written. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ganga flowed in the\nplains due to the efforts of Bhagiratha from the Himalayas to the plains. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Will Narenda Modi be\nthe modern Bhagiratha \u2013 the person who will revive the holy Ganga to its\noriginal pristine glory ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: Mother Ganga&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GqkIhK1onrg/U6pLU6bOgUI/AAAAAAAAtHI/Vfl6-9tgjeA/s1600/goddess-gaffrges-PY55_l.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;LEGEND OF GANGA&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancient&nbsp; kingdom of Ayodhya was ruled by the childless\nking Bhagiratha, who desperately yearned for Ganga to come down and wash away\nthe sins of his forefathers.&nbsp;&nbsp; Even\nthough he ruled over a prosperous kingdom inhabited by happy people,\nBhaigiratha remained sad, as he was childless. He was also saddled with the\nburden of giving moksha to his ancestors.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A long time ago, King\nSagar, the then ruler of Ayodhya, had sent his grandson Suman to search for his\n60,000 sons which were borne to him by his second wife Sumati. (She had\nactually borne a gourd which burst open to give way to these sixty\nthousand\u2014test tube babies .)&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These sons,\nwho were fostered by nurses in jars of ghee till they grew up to handsome boys.\nThey suddenly disappeared mysteriously while they were searching for a lost\nwhite&nbsp; let loose by King Sagar as a part\nof the great horse sacrifice known as the Ahwamedha Yagna.&nbsp; If this sacrifice had reached its logical\nconclusion, Sagar would have become the undisputed master of the Gods.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: x-large;\">Digression :</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the cover of her\nvulgar book Wendy Doniger has alluded that Ashwamedham is a horse sacrifice\u2014as\nper the LIES written in Wikipedia . In Sanatana Dharma there is NO animal\nsacrifice.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>This is what IMMORAL Wikipedia\nhas to say -- ( you can check it yourself by Googling ASHVAMEDHA YAGNA\nWIKIPEDIA ).</b><o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They have even given a\npicture of the Queen lying down with the dead horse ( to be used as dildo for\nsexual gratification ) -- this picture was painted by a Muslim painter\nSahibdin. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JSqo0GWw2Vw/U6pRa866MYI/AAAAAAAAtHg/4Yi0atYdk_8/s1600/300px-Asvamedha_raFRayana.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"354\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JSqo0GWw2Vw/U6pRa866MYI/AAAAAAAAtHg/4Yi0atYdk_8/s1600/300px-Asvamedha_raFRayana.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></span></i></div>\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><o:p></o:p></span></i><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">They say he painted it\nin 1652 AD , which is a lie. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">QUOTE:--</span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Anyone who should stop\nthe horse is ritually cursed, and a </span><span style=\"color: red;\">dog is killed </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">..<o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">The queens walk around\nthe dead horse reciting mantras. The chief queen then has to </span><span style=\"color: red;\">mimic copulation\nwith the dead horse</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">, while the other queens </span><span style=\"color: red;\">ritually utter obscenities </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">(\nprobably they were singing&nbsp; ribald songs\nlike DARA SINGH KA&nbsp; LUND--&nbsp; TEE HEEEE ! ).<o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">On the next morning,\nthe priests </span><span style=\"color: red;\">raise the queen from the place where she has spent the night with\nthe horse. </span><span style=\"color: purple;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">The three queens with a\nhundred golden, silver and copper needles indicate the lines on the horse's\nbody along which it will be dissected. The horse is dissected, and its</span><span style=\"color: red;\"> flesh\nroasted</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">. </span><span style=\"color: red;\">Various parts are offered to a host of deities </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">and personified\nconcepts with </span><span style=\"color: red;\">utterances of svaha \"all-hail\".</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">The human sacrifice,\nthe Purushamedha, followed a similar format,&nbsp;\nbut included a </span><span style=\"color: red;\">man with the animals to be sacrificed.</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"> The price of the\nman was set at one thousand cows and a hundred horses. Like the horse, the man\nchosen for sacrifice was allowed to wander for a year. Once he had been killed,\n</span><span style=\"color: red;\">the queen lay with his corpse.</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">The Laws of Manu refer\nto the Ashvamedha (V.53): 'The man who offers a horse-sacrifice every day for a\nhundred years, and the man who does not eat meat, the two of them reap the same\nfruit of good deeds.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">In the Mahabharata, the\nsacrifice is performed by Yudhishtira (. </span><span style=\"color: red;\">After the horse was cut into parts,\nDraupadi had to sit beside the parts of the horse</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">.)<o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">The ritual was\nperformed </span><span style=\"color: red;\">in strict compliance with Vedic prescriptions</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"> (1.14.10). Dasaratha's\nchief wife Kausalya circumambulates the horse and ritually pierces its flesh\n(1.14.33). <o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\">Then \"Queen\nKausalya desiring the results of ritual disconcertedly resided one night with\nthat horse that flew away like a bird.\" .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">At the conclusion of\nthe ritual </span><span style=\"color: red;\">Dasharatha symbolically offers his other wives to the presiding\npriests</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">, who return them in exchange for expensive gifts.<o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">&nbsp;\"An empire is like a horse and the\nsubjects like other inferior animals\" (p. 448). Thus, VSM 23.22, literally\n\"he beats on the</span><span style=\"color: red;\"> vulva </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">(gabha), the </span><span style=\"color: red;\">penis </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">(pasas) </span><span style=\"color: red;\">oozes repeatedly</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">\n(ni-galgaliti) </span><span style=\"color: red;\">in the receptacle\"</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">\u201c </span><span style=\"color: red;\">The three authors of\nthe Vedas were buffoons, knaves, and demons</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">. All the well-known formulae of the\npandits, jarphari, turphari, etc. and all the</span><span style=\"color: red;\"> obscene rites for the queen\ncommanded in Aswamedha,</span><span style=\"color: purple;\"> these were invented by buffoons, and so all the various\nkinds of presents to the priests, while the </span><span style=\"color: red;\">eating of flesh was similarly\ncommanded by night-prowling demons</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">.\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">The mock bestiality (\nsexual intercourse with animals ) and necrophilia ( sexual attraction to dead\nanimals ) involved in the ritual </span><span style=\"color: purple;\">caused considerable consternation among the\nscholars first editing the Yajurveda. Griffith (1899) omits verses VSM 23.20\u201331\n(the ritual obscenities), protesting that they are \"n</span><span style=\"color: red;\">ot reproducible even\nin the semi-obscurity of a learned European language\" (alluding to other\ninstances where he renders explicit scenes in Latin rather than English)</span><span style=\"color: purple;\">. A. B.\nKeith's 1914 translation also omits verses.<o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">This part of the ritual\noffended the Dalit reformer and framer of the Indian constitution </span><span style=\"color: red;\">B. R.\nAmbedkar </span></span><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">and is frequently mentioned in his writings as an example of the\nperceived degradation of Brahmanical culture.</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">UNQUOTE: </span></b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">So what is the truth\nabout ASHWAMEDHA YAGNA?<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The truth is the horse\nis NOT killed at all-- leave alone the queen having sexual intercourse with a\ndead horse's you know what.. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">A spirited horse is\nchosen , with white fur and no blemishes. A yagna ( Agnihotra homam ) is held\nBEFORE the horse sets out on a guided tour.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Ashwamedha yagna cannot\nbe held by a mortal.&nbsp; It is held by the\nking of Gods Indra.&nbsp; It can only be done\nby a mortal king if he is commanded to do it by an avatar of Vishnu.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">This tradition was\nbroken by King Mahabali of Kerala. He was an asura ( demon ) king. The people\nof Kerala were very happy with this king as he was a wise and just ruler, and\nthere was prosperity all over.&nbsp; King\nMahabali did the Ashwameda yagna.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">This made Indra very\njealous, as this was his prerogative, and nobody had the guts to kill the white\nAshwamedha horse&nbsp; of King Mahabali.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">He prevailed on Aditi,\nhis mother to convince Vishnu to correct this imbalance, where an Asura King\ncould cock a snook at the King of Gods . Vishnu decided to intervene and took\nthe 5th&nbsp; avatar of Vamana --a blue faced\nBrahmin midget ( dwarf ) .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The Brahmin dwarf asked\nKing Mahabali for alms-- a small grant of land.&nbsp;\nThe King told him that he can take as much land area as he wished,\nwithin his kingdom . But the midget wanted only three strides ( paces )&nbsp; of land.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Immediately the kings\nadvisor Sage Shukracharya who was a seer, advised his king NOT to agree to this\nrequest, as he suspected something amiss and was sure of foul play.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Mahabali being a very\ngenerous king, could NOT imagine going back on his word, during a divine\nsacrifice.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">So he agreed to grant\nthe boon of three paces of land. Vamana immediately assumed the gigantic form\nof Vishnu ( the Preserver lord ) and in the first two steps covered the whole\nof earth and cosmos.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></span><i style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">&nbsp;</span></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Then he asked the king\nwhere he should keep his third step. The king bowed down on his knees and told\nhim to place the third step on his head.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Before that he asked\nthat he should be able to visit and bless his subjects once every year .<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Vishnu granted this\nboon and placed his foot on Mahabali's head and instead of driving him\nunderground to the netherworld , he sent him to heaven -- pleased with his\nrighteousness.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">THIS IS THE REASON WHY\nALL MALAYALIS CELEBRATE ONAM -- THE DAY THE KING WILL COME EVERY YEAR.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">A CARPET OF FRESH\nFLOWERS IS LAID AT THE ENTRANCE OF EVERY HOUSE.&nbsp;\nDIWALI OR DEEPAWALI MARKS THE VICTORY OF GODS , OR DEFEAT OF KING\nMAHABALI .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">DIWALI IS CELEBRATED BY\nTHE WHOLE OF INDIA -- EXCEPT KERALA.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">So why is the white\nhorse on a guided tour?&nbsp; This is the\nessence of Ashwameda.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The emperor seeks to check\nout if any of his vassal kings want to challenge his supreme authority\u2014 in\npublic.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The horse is guided by\nthe Emperor\u2019s generals and chosen ministers . They generals follow the white\nhorse on their own horses. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The horse with clanging\nbells is made to travel through the vassal kingdoms.&nbsp; Any vassal king can kill the horse and thus\ndeclare war on the Emperor,&nbsp; which will\nhappen pretty soon.&nbsp; If he just captures\nthe horse, there may be room for negotiation.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">The horse is even taken\nto enemy kingdoms, and there is \u201cdiplomatic immunity\u201d for the Emperor\u2019s men not\nthe white horse.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">Any tough acting\nintentions are gauged out. <o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">When the horse returns\nsafe and sound, it means all is well-- and the emperor's supreme authority is\nunchallenged.&nbsp; And all know it too.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">In the POST Ashwamedha\nyagna all vassal kings are invited, and there are celebrations all around\n,&nbsp; for peace and prosperity&nbsp; in future.&nbsp;\nSoldiers go home to their families.<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: blue;\">IN MODERN TERMS THIS IS\nLIKE A OPEN \"CONFIDENCE \" MOTION IN THE PARLIAMENT.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">Getting back-</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The great sage Kapila\nwho, impressed by Suman's humble demeanor, told him that all sixty thousand\nuncles had been turned to ashes by his angry gaze when they tried to blame him\nfor stealing the white Ashwamedha horse. &nbsp;The horse was just hanging around near the\nmeditating Maharishi. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-t04r7umcFMQ/U6pnND2LOAI/AAAAAAAAtIE/f-p2PDddeiY/s1600/16400nfggj3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"333\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-t04r7umcFMQ/U6pnND2LOAI/AAAAAAAAtIE/f-p2PDddeiY/s1600/16400nfggj3.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Kapila warned that\nthe dead princes would not arrive in heaven by immersion of their ashes in just\nany river water. Only the celestial Ganga, which flows with its sacred water in\nthe heavenly world, could provide salvation.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Time passed by and King\nSagar died with a heavy&nbsp;&nbsp; Suman was now\nthe king, and he ruled his kingdom well. When old age crept upon him, he\ncrowned his son Dileepa as king and proceeded to the Himalayas to undergo sever\npenances, to bring the Ganga down to the earth.&nbsp;\nBut he died before his penance bore fruit.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">King Dileepa knew the\nlast wishes of his father and grandfather .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He performed many yagnas (fire\nritual) on the advice of sages.&nbsp; Pangs of\nsorrow at not being able to fulfill the family's aspiration infected him, and\nhe fell ill.&nbsp; Seeing that he was wasting\naway , he placed his son Bhagiratha on the throne; entrusting him with the\nmission of completing the task still left undone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhagiratha soon handed\nthe kingdom over to his prime minister and went to the Himalayas, performing\nterrible austerities for a long time&nbsp; to\ndraw the Ganga down from the skies. Eventually, humbled by the dogged\ndedication of the ascetic king, Ganga appeared in human form and agreed to\npurify the ashes of Bhagiratha's ancestors.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_Qzq9lFZvnQ/U6sFxS0mjsI/AAAAAAAAtKY/0ZO_J6ataaM/s1600/imy45uages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_Qzq9lFZvnQ/U6sFxS0mjsI/AAAAAAAAtKY/0ZO_J6ataaM/s1600/imy45uages.jpg\" width=\"258\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Ganga agreed to\nbless the earth, a fear loomed. Will the unholy earth be able to withstand the\nmighty pressures of the descending waters ?.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To save the world from\nirreversible calamity, Bhagiratha prayed to Lord Shiva . Shiva assured\nBhariratha that we would receive the impact on his matted locks -to enable the\ngushing waters to exhaust their, furious energy beforehand and then flow gently\non earth..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ganga rushed fell\nin a mighty torrent onto Shiva's and calmed down in the passage through Lord Shiva\u2019s&nbsp; matted locks. The Mother Goddess fell upon\nthe earth, in seven distinct streams: Hladini, Nalini and Pavani flowed east,\nSubhikshu, Sitha and Sindhu flowed west, and the seventh stream followed the\nchariot of Bhagiratha to the place where the ashes of his great-grandfathers\nlay in heaps- souls awaiting moksha .&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ganga flowed over\nthe ashes of the 60,000 sons of King Sagar to deliver moksha , and usher the\nsouls to the gilded gates of Vaikunta.. The celestial Ganga, is still falling\nfrom the heavens, timeless- gushing through Shiva's tangled locks, down to the\nearth, where sinners and worthy men alike flock to bathe in her waters and\ndrink a gulpful .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">SECRETS OF SHANKH OR\nCONCH, THE PRODUCT OF SAMUDRA MANTHAN VADAKAYIL</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is well known that\nthe Ganga river carries the highest silt load of any river in the world and the\ndeposition of this material in the delta region results in the largest river\ndelta in the world (400 km from north to south and 320 km from east to west).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I agree with you.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ganges delta is\nfast shrinking. The reason is silt held back by dam reservoirs. A delta can\nform only where the sediment volume supplied from a river can overwhelm the\nlocal ocean energy (waves, tides, currents).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rivers are not only conduits of water.&nbsp;\nThey are a complex, moving systems carrying sediment, nutrients,\norganisms, ecosystems, energy, material and cultures in their wake.&nbsp; Sediment retention&nbsp; reduces the life of the dam, while starving\nthe river and delta in the downstream of sediment.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sunderban is a unique\necosystem dominated by mangrove forests and gets its name from the Sundari\ntrees. Sunderban is spread over 54 islands and two countries. It is one of the\nlast preserves of the Bengal tiger and the site of a tiger preservation\nproject..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The population of the\nBengal tiger is dwindling.&nbsp; The majestic\nBengal tiger is even losing weight because of \"stress\" associated\nwith environmental changes impacting their natural habitat in the Sunderban\nmangrove swamps. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-KmoBpc5QVFw/U6rMwWyPVRI/AAAAAAAAtJo/-WiLy4Ml-h4/s1600/dfggownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-KmoBpc5QVFw/U6rMwWyPVRI/AAAAAAAAtJo/-WiLy4Ml-h4/s1600/dfggownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tigers in the\nSunderbans are now lighter and their body parts smaller compared to a decade\nago. Saline water ingress is ruining the Sunderbans.&nbsp; Delta loss&nbsp;\nhas reduced the number of fresh water ponds which attract the tigers'\nmain prey.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under-fed and\nmalnourished, tigers are now straying into human habitats in search of goats\nand cows.&nbsp; We are given unsolicited bull\nby the global warming stooges of big brother that sea level is rising and\ndeltas are getting swamped.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Bengal tiger is an\nexpert swimmer. &nbsp;This poor tiger has even\nlost the sheen of it fantastic fur, due to saline ingress .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BoMFxqB_O3g/U6rNu8K9UjI/AAAAAAAAtJw/SNiJ0ifBc0w/s1600/downlodebnad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-BoMFxqB_O3g/U6rNu8K9UjI/AAAAAAAAtJw/SNiJ0ifBc0w/s1600/downlodebnad.jpg\" width=\"265\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hey, how about the delta land level lowering due to\nloss of silt and sedimentation \u2013leading to catastrophic sea level rise ?. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">which hold back silt to bullsh#t climate change? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The direct impacts of\ndelta subsidence and effective seas level rise include inundation of coastal\nareas, saltwater intrusion into coastal aquifers, increased rates of coastal\nerosion, an increased exposure to storm surges.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Below: Toxic effluents are pumped out at night , using portable discharge pipes. Any tannery with such pipes must be shut down</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5tSAnU2pTm0/V0mmv0HrwAI/AAAAAAABJMs/MnjCwxb4pS41RW_X0Bs9sLGQJwI4L0AxgCLcB/s1600/Copy%2BoHHf%2BDSCN4468.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-5tSAnU2pTm0/V0mmv0HrwAI/AAAAAAABJMs/MnjCwxb4pS41RW_X0Bs9sLGQJwI4L0AxgCLcB/s640/Copy%2BoHHf%2BDSCN4468.JPG\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is in addition to the\nthreats to food security, livelihood security, water security for millions and\na huge loss of biodiversity. These threats impact hundreds of millions of\npeople who inhabit the delta regions as well as the ecologically sensitive and\nimportant coastal wetland and mangrove forests. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Food security does NOT\nmean giving free food to physically and mentally healthy people as an Italian\nwaitress has done recently .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It means\nallowing wisdom to flow ( which we Indians do NOT lack ) and do what is\nnecessary to strike at the root of the problem\u2014 lowering of ground water levels,\nloss of coastal ground water aquifers, lowering of delta etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most plastics are\nderived from propylene, a simple chemical component of petroleum. When heated\nup in the presence of a catalyst, individual chemical units monomers of\npropylene link together by forming extremely strong carbon-carbon bonds with\neach other. This results in polymers long chains of monomers called\npolypropylene.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nature doesn't make\nnon-biodegradable things like that.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><b>All that is required to\nprevent PLASTICS being thrown around carelessly which finds it way into rivers and\nwater bodies is ONE SENTENCE OF FIAT and POLITICAL WILL from Narendra Modi. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The source of river\nYamuna is the Yamunotri Glacier at a height of 6,387 metres on the south\nwestern slopes of Banderpooch peaks in the uppermost region of the Lower Himalayas\nin Uttarakhand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Yamuna joins the\nsacred Ganga, at Allahabad, after traversing 1375 km. &nbsp;Yamuna merges with the Ganges at Triveni\nSangam, Allahabad, the site for the Kumbha Mela every twelve years<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though the Yamuna is\nthe largest tributary of the Ganga, yet in long stretches, she flows like a\nsmall rivulet. The flow of the Yamuna cannot be termed as continuous. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yamuna has four\ndistinct flow patterns. Its first phase is from Yamunotri to the Tajewala\nbarrage, 172 km. The second phase is from the Tajewala barrage to the Wazirabad\nbarrage, 224 km. And the third phase is through Delhi, from the Wazirabad\nbarrage to the Okhla barrage, 22 km. The final phase of the river is from the\nOkhla barrage till it converges into the Ganga, 958 km away at Allahabad. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Between the Wazirabad\nbarrage and the Okhla barrage, the mighty Yamuna is converted into a filthy\nstinking &nbsp;sewage drain.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>The water in the Yamuna river remains stagnant for\nalmost nine months in a year thanks to the <span style=\"color: red;\">MAD CHOOTS. </span>&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hardly any rainwater harvesting to recharge groundwater\naquifers &nbsp;is done in Delhi, though the\nsoil is conducive .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 50% of the\nthe colonies in Delhi are illegal, unregularized or unauthorized which discharges\nuntreated sewage into the Yamuna.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For major part of the\nyear, river Yamuna does not flow downstream of Wazirabad barrage as all the\nriver water upstream of the barrage is ponded (harnessed) for water supply in\nDelhi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yamuna river is holy\ntoo because &nbsp;it flows through Vrindavana\nand Mathura, connected with Lord Krishna. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
